French: Quel est le pays le plus pauvre de l'Union Européenne ?

French: Vous avez perdu une boucle d'oreille.

English: I don't mind hot weather.
French: Le temps chaud ne me dérange pas.

English: Who are you all?
French: Qui êtes-vous tous ?

English: I picked you some flowers.
French: Je t'ai cueilli des fleurs.

English: I don't want to sleep.
French: Je ne veux pas dormir.

English: Get out of here immediately!
French: Sors d'ici, tout de suite !

English: Why's Tom always here?
French: Pourquoi Tom est-il toujours ici ?

English: Tom is the person who helped Mary.
French: Tom est la personne qui a aidé Mary.

English: We have our differences.
French: Nous avons nos divergences.

English: One of these eggs hasn't hatched yet.
French: L'un de ces œufs n'a pas encore éclos.

English: I'd like to reserve a seat.
French: J'aimerais réserver une place assise.

English: Did I give you the tickets?
French: Vous ai-je donné les places ?

English: I don't know what I was thinking.
French: Je ne sais pas à quoi je pensais.

English: The apples which he sent to me were delicious.
French: Les pommes qu'il m'a fait parvenir étaient délicieuses.

English: Man is the only animal that can laugh.
French: L’Homme est le seul animal qui peut rigoler.

English: You can borrow three books at a time.
French: Tu peux emprunter trois livres chaque fois.

English: This custom dates back to the 12th century.
French: Cette coutume remonte au douzième siècle.

English: She plays tennis after school.
French: Elle joue au tennis après l'école.

English: I don't want you to leave.
French: Je ne veux pas que vous partiez.

English: I can't carry on like this.

English: Keep your hands up.

English: He has no hat on.
French: Il ne porte pas de chapeau.

English: A curtain of mist blocked our view.
French: Un rideau de brume nous obstruait la vue.

English: Tom owes Mary a lot of money.
French: Tom doit beaucoup d'argent à Mary.

English: What's not to like?

English: I don't want to talk about this now.
French: Je ne veux pas en parler pour l'instant.

English: I can't remember her address.
French: Je n'arrive pas à me souvenir de son adresse.

English: She picked him up at the station.
French: Elle l'a pris à la gare.

English: I'm going to America this summer.
French: Je vais en Amérique cet été.

English: What languages are spoken in America?
French: Quelles langues parle-t-on en Amérique ?

English: I thought I recognized Tom.
French: Je pensais avoir reconnu Tom.

English: It is premature to discuss it now.
French: Il est prématuré d'en débattre maintenant.

English: I think it's highly unlikely that we'll be able to escape from this prison.
French: Je pense qu'il est hautement improbable que nous serons en mesure de nous échapper de cette prison.

English: To the best of my knowledge, this is the only translation available.
French: Pour autant que je sache, c'est l'unique traduction.

English: This is big.
French: C'est grand.

English: I really owe you an apology.
French: Je vous dois vraiment des excuses.

English: I figured you might want a drink.
French: J'ai pensé qu'il se pouvait que tu veuilles boire un coup.

English: The tower can be seen from here.
French: La tour peut être vue d'ici.

English: He can't sing.
French: Il ne sait pas chanter.

English: I had nothing to do with that problem.
French: Je n'avais rien à voir avec ce problème.

English: You were hurt, weren't you?
French: Tu as été blessée, n'est-ce pas ?

English: Calm down!

English: You're too suspicious about everything.

English: I wish you'd talk to me.

English: Life seems so unfair.

English: The sisters hate each other.
French: Les sœurs se détestent mutuellement.

English: She panicked when she heard the news.
French: Elle paniqua quand elle entendit la nouvelle.

English: This train is bound for Boston.
French: Ce train est à destination de Boston.

English: The old man narrowly escaped being run over by a car.
French: Le vieil homme échappa de justesse d'être renversé par une voiture.

English: Do you really not know?

English: Are you sure you're not tired?

English: You don't have the guts.

English: You said it wasn't going to happen.

English: I still need to talk to you.
French: Il me faut encore vous parler.

English: Can we afford a new car?

English: The terrible scene made him tremble in fear.
French: La scène effroyable le fit trembler de peur.

English: Here's where the fun begins.
French: C'est là qu'on commence à rigoler.

English: We're deluding ourselves.

English: Tokyo is a very expensive place to live.
French: Tokyo est un lieu où la vie est très onéreuse.

English: For here, or to go?
French: Pour consommer sur place ou à emporter ?

English: What are you doing up?

English: I'm the oldest.
French: Je suis la plus vieille.

English: I can't blame him.
French: Je ne peux pas le blâmer.

English: They're undamaged.
French: Elles sont intactes.

English: We accepted his offer.
French: Nous avons accepté son offre.

English: Does anyone know Japanese?
French: Quiconque connaît-il le japonais ?

English: An accident may happen at any time.
French: Un accident peut se produire à tout moment.

English: She died in a bike accident.
French: Elle est morte dans un accident de vélo.

English: Tom is recovering from his injuries.
French: Tom récupère de ses blessures.

English: Can you swim as fast as he can?
French: Sais-tu nager aussi vite que lui ?

English: All my friends say that.
French: Tous mes amis disent ça.

English: Surprisingly, I agree with Tom.
French: Étonnamment, je suis d'accord avec Tom.

English: This book is full of errors.
French: Cet livre est truffé d'erreurs.

English: What do I have to lose?

English: I know that I do not know.
French: Je sais que je ne sais pas.

English: In spite of the storm, he went out.
French: Il sortit en dépit de la tempête.

English: I spend as much time working in the garden in one day as my brother does in a week.
French: Je passe autant de temps à travailler au jardin en un jour que ce que mon frère passe en une semaine.

English: I've never used a hacksaw before. Could you show me how?
French: Je n'ai jamais utilisé de scie à métaux avant. Tu pourrais me montrer ?

English: I don't really understand the problem.
French: Je ne comprends pas vraiment le problème.

English: What do you do on Fridays?
French: Que fais-tu le vendredi ?

English: Drive on.
French: Avancez !

English: I didn't know that you used to work here.
French: J'ignorais que tu avais travaillé ici.

English: It costs $100 a night not counting tax.
French: Cela coûte 100 dollars par nuit hors taxe.

English: I know who killed my parents.
French: Je sais qui a tué mes parents.

English: She cooked her husband an apple pie.
French: Elle a cuisiné une tarte aux pommes pour son mari.

English: Please don't forget to mail the letters.
French: N'oublie pas de poster les lettres, je te prie.

English: If he sends me any letters, I just tear them up and throw them away.
French: Quelque lettre qu'il m'envoie, je la déchire et la jette, rien de plus.

English: We were disappointed.
French: Nous étions déçues.

English: Tom still despises me.
French: Tom me méprise encore.

English: You should keep your promises.
French: Tu devrais tenir tes promesses.

English: I think you're going to want to sit down.
French: Je pense que tu vas vouloir t'asseoir.

English: Are you out of your mind?
French: Êtes-vous fou ?

English: She had tears in her eyes.
French: Elle avait des larmes dans les yeux.

English: Tom said that was OK.
French: Tom a dit que c'était bon.

English: He lay on his back on the bed.
French: Il était allongé sur le dos sur le lit.

English: I was probably thirty years old at that time.
French: J'avais probablement trente ans à cette époque.

English: The prince was lost in the woods.
French: Le prince était perdu dans les bois.

English: I never realized how much I would miss you.
French: Je n'ai jamais pris conscience de combien vous me manqueriez.

English: I got fined.
French: J'ai pris une contredanse.

English: Do you feel lucky?
French: Vous sentez-vous chanceuse ?

English: I really appreciate your offer to help me clean out my garage.
French: Je vous suis vraiment reconnaissante pour votre proposition de m'aider à nettoyer mon garage.

English: Leave it.
French: Laisse tomber !

English: Are you sure of it?
French: En êtes-vous sûrs ?

English: Will you join us?
French: Vous joindrez-vous à nous ?

English: Is anyone looking?
French: Quiconque regarde-t-il ?

English: He is the only one of my friends that is talented.
French: C'est le seul de mes amis qui a du talent.

English: It was a revelation to me.
French: Ce fut une révélation pour moi.

English: I'll be back by six o'clock.
French: Je reviens à six heures.

English: She went to the hospital by taxi.
French: Elle se rendit à l'hôpital en taxi.

English: Don't go without a hat.
French: N'y va pas sans chapeau.

English: I got acquainted with him last year.
French: J'ai fait sa connaissance l'année dernière.

English: Why do you need a doctor?
French: Pourquoi as-tu besoin d'un docteur ?

English: I made him change his plan.
French: Je l'ai amené à changer son plan.

English: I didn't mean to interrupt anything.
French: Je n'avais pas l'intention d'interrompre quoi que ce fut.

English: I'm running out of energy.
French: Je suis à court d'énergie.

English: I hate her parents.
French: Je déteste ses parents.

English: Nobody trusts Tom anymore.
French: Plus personne ne fait confiance à Tom.

English: Pardon me?
French: Je vous demande pardon ?

English: Please stay as long as you wish.
French: Je vous en prie, prenez votre temps.

English: Don't leave the TV on.
French: Ne laisse pas la télévision allumée !

English: I don't care for wine.
French: Le vin m'est indifférent.

English: I'd like to talk with you.
French: J'aimerais te parler.

English: It's been more than a month.
French: Ça fait plus d'un mois.

English: He seemed to like that.
French: Il semblait l'apprécier.

English: I can't believe it's really you.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que ce soit vraiment toi.

English: How's your cold?
French: Comment va votre rhume ?

English: Stories often have happy endings.
French: Les histoires ont souvent une fin heureuse.

English: I only hope we're not too late.
French: J'espère juste qu'on n'arrive pas trop tard.

English: I'm too sleepy to do my homework.
French: J'ai trop sommeil pour faire mes devoirs.

English: Take it.
French: Prends-le !

English: The girls are excited.
French: Les filles sont enthousiastes.

English: Tom has his own bedroom.
French: Tom a sa propre chambre.

English: I'd like to be more than just friends.
French: J'aimerais que nous soyons davantage que juste des amis.

English: He looks very sleepy.
French: Il a l'air très endormi.

English: Tom married a Canadian girl.
French: Tom a épousé une Canadienne.

English: You didn't have to lie.
French: Il n'était pas nécessaire que vous mentiez.

English: I have no one to talk to.
French: Je n'ai personne à qui parler.

English: It was very cold yesterday morning.
French: Il faisait très froid hier matin.

English: Why are you so cheerful?
French: Pourquoi es-tu si joyeux ?

English: When do you plan to start?
French: Quand prévois-tu de démarrer ?

English: I'm going to go buy a ticket, so please watch my bags for a minute.
French: Je vais aller acheter un ticket, alors merci de surveiller mes sacs une minute.

English: Do it yourself.
French: Faites-le vous-même.

English: Be creative.
French: Soyez créatif !

English: You can't just walk in here and start dictating policy.
French: Tu ne peux pas entrer ici et commencer à dicter la politique.

English: They're not going to be able to find the hotel.
French: Ils ne vont pas pouvoir trouver l'hôtel.

English: This bag cost me 6 pounds.
French: Ce sac m'a couté six livres.

English: Why do people dye their hair?
French: Pourquoi les gens se teignent-ils les cheveux ?

English: I had a hunch you would do that.
French: J'ai eu le pressentiment que tu ferais ça.

English: I continued singing.
French: J'ai continué à chanter.

English: Sitting all day isn't good for you.
French: Être assise toute la journée n'est pas bon pour toi.

English: Try this instead.
French: Essayez plutôt ceci.

English: I study English at home.
French: J'étudie l'anglais chez moi.

English: No one died.
French: Personne n'est mort.

English: I never wanted to compete with you.
French: Je n'ai jamais voulu vous concurrencer.

English: I tried to do all I could.
French: J'ai tenté de faire tout ce que je pouvais.

English: My advice is for you to go home.
French: Je te conseille de rentrer à la maison.

English: We bought a round table.
French: Nous avons acheté une table ronde.

English: You don't have to lie.
French: Vous n'êtes pas forcées de mentir.

English: Do I look dead to you?
French: Ai-je l'air morte, selon toi ?

English: Can you give me another example?
French: Peux-tu me fournir un autre exemple ?

English: What happens tomorrow?
French: Que va-t-il se passer demain ?

English: I have no plans whatever.
French: Je n'ai aucun plan, quel qu'il soit.

English: I want to go abroad.
French: Je veux partir à l'étranger.

English: I don't recall asking for your opinion.
French: Je ne me rappelle pas avoir requis ton opinion.

English: You're very resourceful.
French: Tu es plein de ressources.

English: That's the eject button. Don't touch it.
French: Il s'agit du bouton d'éjection. N'y touchez pas !

English: Does that mean you'll have to stay?
French: Cela signifie-t-il que vous devrez rester ?

English: You have no idea how tired I am of all this complaining.
French: Vous n'avez pas idée de combien je suis fatiguée par toutes ces récriminations.

English: There is a nice park in the center of the town.
French: Il y a un chouette parc au centre de la ville.

English: Tom certainly fooled me.
French: Tom m'a certainement trompé.

English: I received a good job offer.
French: J'ai reçu une bonne offre d'emploi.

English: You can't pay someone to sleep for you.
French: Tu ne peux pas payer quelqu'un pour dormir à ta place.

English: Where is the bathroom?
French: Où sont les toilettes ?

English: I don't believe that Santa Claus is imaginary.
French: Je ne crois pas que le Père Noël soit imaginaire.

English: You shouldn't be impatient with children.
French: Vous ne devriez pas être impatients avec les enfants.

English: Who are you and where do you come from?
French: Qui êtes-vous et d'où venez-vous ?

English: I'm already done.
French: J'ai déjà fini.

English: They worked through the night.
French: Ils ont travaillé toute la nuit.

English: I did it anyway.
French: Je l'ai fait quand même.

English: The lunar month is shorter than the calendar month.
French: Le mois lunaire est plus court que le mois du calendrier.

English: Why are you so insecure?
French: Pourquoi vous sentez-vous si peu sûrs de vous ?

English: Stay calm and do your best.
French: Reste calme et fais de ton mieux !

English: Why didn't you tell me?

English: I'm not paying for this.

English: I don't blame you.
French: Je ne te le reproche pas.

English: Discretion is the better part of valor.
French: La meilleure partie du courage réside dans la prudence.

English: I'm just looking out for myself.
French: Je m'inquiète pour moi.

English: I think Tom can help Mary.
French: Je crois que Tom peut aider Mary.

English: My mother was crying.
French: Ma mère pleurait.

English: I didn't even get one letter from her.
French: Je n'ai pas reçu ne serait-ce qu'une lettre d'elle.

English: Do you know which deity this temple is dedicated to?
French: Savez-vous à quelle divinité ce temple est dédié ?

English: I didn't have time to think. I had to make a judgment call.
French: Je n'avais pas le temps de penser. J'ai dû trancher.

English: Do you speak Chinese?
French: Parles-tu chinois ?

English: Are you seriously thinking about driving all night?
French: Envisages-tu sérieusement de conduire toute la nuit ?

English: I have a dictionary.
French: J'ai le dictionnaire.

English: He came to see you yesterday.
French: Il est venu te voir hier.

English: I'd be happy to show it to you.
French: Je serais heureux de vous le montrer.

English: Do you mind if I park here?
French: Voyez-vous un inconvénient à ce que je me gare ici ?

English: I can't afford to do that.
French: Je n'ai pas les moyens de faire ça.

English: I am glad to help you.
French: Je suis content de t'aider.

English: He has decided not to go to the meeting.
French: Il a décidé de ne pas se rendre à la réunion.

English: When she was in Los Angeles, she had at least six different jobs.
French: Quand elle était à Los Angeles, elle a eu au moins six travails différents.

English: Breakfast is served.
French: Le petit-déjeuner est servi.

English: Come on, hurry up. You'll miss the bus.
French: Allez, dépêche-toi. Tu vas rater le bus.

English: It cost me one thousand yen to get the bicycle fixed.
French: Cela m'a coûté mille yen pour faire réparer mon vélo.

English: Excuse me, is this seat taken?
French: Excusez-moi, cette place est-elle prise ?

English: Do I look like I'm having fun?
French: Ai-je l'air de prendre du plaisir ?

English: A plane is flying above the city.
French: Un avion vole au-dessus de la ville.

English: You can't keep doing this, Tom.
French: Tu ne peux pas continuer comme ça, Tom.

English: I'd like to talk to the coordinator of this project.
French: J'aimerais discuter avec le coordonnateur de ce projet.

English: We played on the beach.
French: Nous avons joué sur la plage.

English: We're not sure yet.
French: Nous n'en sommes pas encore sûres.

English: May I introduce myself?
French: Puis-je me présenter ?

English: I'm an actress, not a model.
French: Je suis actrice, non mannequin.

English: I can't imagine your not knowing her address.
French: Je ne peux concevoir que vous ne connaissiez pas son adresse.

English: It is necessary for you to go.
French: Il faut que tu y ailles.

English: Could you please fix this flat tire?
French: Pourriez-vous réparer ce pneu à plat, je vous prie ?

English: We're almost ready.
French: Nous sommes presque prêtes.

English: Turn the lights out now.
French: Éteins les lumières, maintenant !

English: They are very kind.
French: Elles sont très bienveillantes.

English: Give me your keys.
French: Donnez-moi vos clés !

English: If you have a question, please raise your right hand.
French: Si tu as une question, lève la main droite, je te prie.

English: Tom told Mary to stop eating.
French: Tom a dit à Mary d'arrêter de manger.

English: He lived there all by himself.
French: Il vécut là tout seul.

English: I took a painkiller for my headache.
French: J'ai pris un antalgique pour mon mal de tête.

English: I never thought it would be so exciting.
French: Je n'ai jamais pensé que ça serait aussi excitant.

English: I am drinking coffee.
French: Je suis en train de boire du café.

English: I have one sister.
French: J'ai une sœur.

English: There's another reason.
French: Il y a une autre raison.

English: That's why I wanted you to know.
French: C'est pourquoi je voulais que tu le saches.

English: What is the tallest mountain in Europe?
French: Quelle est la plus haute montagne d'Europe ?

English: Don't you move or I'll shoot.
French: Ne bouge pas ou je tire !

English: He's a historian.
French: Il est historien.

English: I loved you.
French: Je t'ai aimé.

English: There is a lot of money.
French: Il y a beaucoup d'argent.

English: She can't control her children.
French: Elle n'arrive pas à tenir ses enfants.

English: Tom is fairly ambitious, isn't he?
French: Tom est assez ambitieux, n'est-ce pas ?

English: Take off your cap.
French: Ôtez votre casquette.

English: I hate myself.
French: Je me déteste.

English: Could you call me back later?
French: Pourriez-vous me rappeler plus tard ?

English: My father is a doctor.
French: Mon père est toubib.

English: I've got a bad hangover.
French: J'ai une énorme gueule de bois.

English: Do you remember anything?
French: Te rappelles-tu quoi que ce soit ?

English: We haven't finished.
French: Nous n'avons pas fini.

English: Are you with us, Tom?
French: Es-tu avec nous, Tom ?

English: He did not want her to leave.
French: Il ne voulait pas qu'elle parte.

English: This is fine.
French: C'est parfait.

English: What is all this stuff?
French: C'est quoi, tous ces trucs ?

English: Friends help each other. Just let me know what's wrong.
French: Les amis doivent s'entraider. Dis-moi ce qui ne va pas.

English: I think Tom is a really nice kid.
French: Je pense que Tom est un gamin vraiment gentil.

English: What's the purpose of your trip?
French: Quel est le but de votre voyage ?

English: I'm not the coach.
French: Je ne suis pas l'entraîneur.

English: Did anybody see what happened?
French: Quiconque a-t-il vu ce qui a eu lieu ?

English: This is not my first time.
French: Ce n'est pas ma première fois.

English: I'd like to order the same.
French: J'aimerais commander le même.

English: I don't care who you're going with.
French: Je me fiche de savoir avec qui vous allez.

English: You'd better not do it.
French: Vous feriez mieux de ne pas le faire.

English: I really need you.
French: J'ai vraiment besoin de toi.

English: I asked my teacher what I should do next.
French: J'ai demandé à mon institutrice ce que je devais faire ensuite.

English: He pushed me gently.
French: Il m'a poussée avec douceur.

English: Nearly one billion people around the globe lack access to clean, safe water.
French: Près d'un milliard de personnes autour de la planète manque d'un accès à de l'eau propre et saine.

English: I changed my hairstyle.
French: J'ai changé de style de coiffure.

English: It all started on a hot summer night.
French: Tout a commencé par une chaude nuit d'été.

English: Please move the TV set to the left.
French: S'il te plait, déplace le poste de télévision vers la gauche.

English: I don't understand what all of the fuss is about.
French: Je ne comprends pas pourquoi on fait tout ce foin.

English: Just think about how you'd feel in a similar situation.
French: Pensez simplement à ce que vous ressentiriez en pareille situation !

English: This is the church where Blake is buried.
French: C'est l'église où Blake est enterré.

English: He was perfect.
French: Il fut parfait.

English: Everybody knows me.
French: Tout le monde me connait.

English: I'm sorry that I've made you so unhappy.
French: Je suis désolée de t'avoir rendue si malheureuse.

English: She gets good marks in English.
French: Elle obtient de bonnes notes en anglais.

English: You have a lot of books.
French: Tu as beaucoup de livres.

English: I took my shoes off.
French: J'ai retiré mes chaussures.

English: I have no interest in putting my money into your dreams.
French: Je n'ai aucun intérêt à placer mon argent dans tes rêves.

English: Don't worry. You can count on me.
French: Ne vous inquiétez pas. Vous pouvez me faire confiance.

English: I heard a woman scream.
French: J'ai entendu crier une femme.

English: You haven't heard the half of it yet.
French: Vous n'en avez pas encore entendu la moitié.

English: Keep your hands off my bicycle.
French: Bas les pattes de mon vélo !

English: Remember not to tell anyone.
French: Souvenez-vous de ne le dire à personne !

English: I think Tom is here already.
French: Je pense que Tom est déjà là.

English: Do you have a pet?
French: Avez-vous un animal domestique ?

English: Telephone booths are very scarce around here.
French: Les cabines téléphoniques sont très rares, dans les environs.

English: I'm counting how many people there are.
French: Je suis en train de compter combien de gens il y a.

English: Tom is too young to go to school.
French: Tom est trop petit pour aller à l'école.

English: Don't make me hurt you.
French: Ne m'obligez pas à vous faire mal !

English: Heat turns ice into water.
French: La chaleur transforme la glace en eau.

English: That's no excuse.
French: Ça ne constitue pas une excuse.

English: We need to come to an agreement.
French: Nous devons arriver à un accord.

English: I feel bad about ruining your party.
French: Je me sens mal d'avoir gâché ta fête.

English: The surgeon amputated the wrong leg.

English: Tom left the door unlocked.
French: Tom n'a pas verrouillé la porte.

English: I was not pleased.

English: Tom would do anything to get Mary's attention.

English: You're never too old to learn.

English: You are apt to be forgetful.

English: That was a great movie.

English: It's you who've acted inappropriately.

English: He does speak well.

English: At what age do you want to get married?

English: I'm all yours.

English: It's already time to go to sleep.

English: Strictly speaking, Chinese consists of hundreds of dialects.
French: À strictement parler, le chinois est composé de centaines de dialectes.

English: Let me remind you of something.

English: I remember something.

English: The more I think about it, the less I understand it.

English: He is a handsome man.

English: I can read.

English: You're very sophisticated.

English: What will we eat?

English: She got a present from her boyfriend.

English: The crowd poured out of the auditorium.
French: La foule se déversa de l'auditorium.

English: Can you shut the door on your way out?

English: Tom talks too fast.

English: I don't have a prejudice against foreign workers.
French: Je n'ai pas de préjugé contre les travailleurs étrangers.

English: This is kind of embarrassing.
French: C'est un peu gênant.

English: Tom also has a brother.

English: I can't believe you did all this without any help.

English: Today was a terrible day.

English: She fell down and hurt her knee.

English: Be polite to your parents.

English: I'm not taking sides.

English: Please excuse me for being rude.

English: They decided on the date and location of their wedding.
French: Elles ont décidé de la date et du lieu de leur mariage.

English: From space, the earth looks quite small.
French: De l'espace, la Terre a l'air plutôt petite.

English: What is the most romantic city in the world?
French: Quelle est la ville la plus romantique du monde ?

English: How could you help me?

English: Are you still not convinced?

English: You saved us all.

English: I attended the meeting yesterday.
French: J'ai assisté à la réunion d'hier.

English: Why did you call?

English: I know somebody who can help us.

English: She is coming home at the end of this month.
French: Elle rentre à la maison à la fin du mois.

English: Do you have any plans for the weekend?

English: What language do you speak?

English: His car is two years old.

English: Can you carve the chicken?

English: I think it's time for me to come clean.

English: I'm begging you, before freaking out on me listen to the end of what I have to say.
French: Je t'en supplie, écoute ce que j'ai à te dire jusqu'au bout avant de piquer une crise sur moi.

English: Can you think of anything else?

English: They found each other.

English: With a little more effort, he would have succeeded.

English: It is kind of pretty, isn't it?

English: She didn't try to evade the truth.

English: Nothing is the matter with me.

English: You seemed to like that.

English: I have to warn him.

English: He has a butler and a cook.

English: You'll never leave this town.

English: I thought you were in charge.

English: I like your house.

English: I know it's hard to walk away.

English: It could have been worse.

English: There is no problem.

English: Try to be more punctual from now on.
French: Essayez d'être plus ponctuels, désormais.

English: He was sworn in as mayor.

English: Have you already eaten?

English: I can't see well.

English: He felt ill at ease.

English: Does Tom really deserve to be punished?

English: Not all of the staff was present.

English: He is ahead of his class in English.

English: He had called the rebels traitors.

English: When I have migraines, aspirin doesn't alleviate the pain for me.

English: See if the gas is turned off.

English: Don't beat yourself up.

English: I was trapped.

English: I want this suit cleaned.
French: Je voudrais faire nettoyer ce costume.

English: My annual income exceeds five million yen.
French: Mon revenu annuel dépasse les 5 millions de yens.

English: Do you mind if I join you?
French: Voyez-vous un inconvénient à ce que je me joigne à vous ?

English: Consult a doctor.
French: Consulte un médecin !

English: Tom's friends tried to cheer him up.
French: Les amis de Tom ont essayé de lui remonter le moral.

English: They'll take me away.

English: We are in a library.
French: Nous sommes dans une bibliothèque.

English: Why do you want me to wait in here?

English: She cried and cried, but no one came to comfort her.
French: Elle pleura tant et plus mais personne ne vint la réconforter.

English: Not much money is required.
French: Peu d'argent est nécessaire.

English: Have you been told when you are expected to be here?

English: Are you saying no?

English: I don't have any close friends.
French: Je n'ai aucun ami proche.

English: God knows we did everything we could.
French: Dieu sait que nous avons fait tout ce que nous pouvions.

English: You should give up drinking and smoking.
French: Tu devrais arrêter de fumer et de boire.

English: I'm too tired to think about that now.

English: If you teach me how to dance, I will show you my hidden scars.
French: Si tu m’apprends à danser, je te montrerai mes cicatrices cachées.

English: Eventually, Tom will likely agree to help us.
French: Tom finira sûrement par accepter de nous aider.

English: Tell Tom I'll be back.
French: Dites à Tom que je reviendrai.

English: You're good.

English: Our house faces the beach.
French: Notre maison est face à la plage.

English: We're all busy.
French: Nous sommes tous occupés.

English: Stay calm.

English: I have some good news to share.
French: J'ai quelques bonnes nouvelles à partager.

English: I put some milk in my coffee.
French: J'ai mis un peu de lait dans mon café.

English: Take whichever you like best.
French: Prends celui que tu préfères.

English: No matter what you say, I won't give up.
French: Quoi que vous disiez, je n'abandonnerai pas.

English: It's been three years since we got married.
French: Ça fait trois ans que nous nous sommes mariés.

English: I just wanted to say thank you for all your help.

English: You should get your eyes examined.

English: I stared at the ceiling.

English: We climbed the steep slope.
French: Nous grimpâmes une pente raide.

English: I have a terrible pain.

English: You were drunk, weren't you?

English: Come join us.

English: I was burned.

English: The problem isn't that.
French: Ce n'est pas le problème.

English: I don't like you at all.

English: Have you been listening to me?

English: My toe started bleeding.

English: He is respected by them.

English: Why are you helping me?

English: Aren't you a little young?

English: I should've guessed you'd be busy.

English: I'm proud of you.

English: All I want is your cat.

English: Is it your bike?

English: Did you go out last night?

English: I predicted it.

English: I want to date other women.
French: Je veux sortir avec d'autres femmes.

English: Turn right there.
French: Tournez là-devant à droite.

English: At last, we reached our destination.
French: Nous avons finalement atteint notre destination.

English: Don't tell me what I already know.

English: They said they would not fight.

English: We'll probably all be dead soon.
French: Nous serons bientôt probablement tous morts.

English: This painting has already been sold.
French: Ce tableau a déjà été vendu.

English: Take a look.

English: I didn't want to bug you.

English: It's not always like that.

English: Tom will be here tonight.

English: The lavishness of the party amazed everybody.

English: He made his parents happy.

English: This is different.

English: I know what this is about.

English: You never have any money.

English: Do you have some money?

English: Should I wait for you here?

English: She tried to conceal the fact.

English: Are you satisfied with my explanation?

English: Are you busy right now?

English: The sales of this model took off.
French: Les ventes de ce modèle se sont envolées.

English: It rained heavily.

English: I have to find her.

English: I am still attached to this bicycle.

English: Are you satisfied with the political situation in your country?

English: What are some foods you usually eat with a spoon?

English: What are you crying for?

English: I'm not really worried.

English: My uncle is a lousy driver.

English: It couldn't have happened at a worse time.

English: It was very ugly.

English: I do not know who is good enough for him.

English: There's a lot to do.

English: Did somebody call the police?

English: I will obey.

English: You're just not the person I thought you were.

English: She can't tell right from wrong.

English: He's back from his travels in Central Asia.

English: They have nothing in common.

English: You're hurting me.

English: This is an exception to the rule.

English: I want it to be a success.

English: This is not natural.

English: You must do it quickly.

English: What are you good at?

English: We're still friends.

English: Tom was fast asleep.

English: Tom has done what he had to do.

English: He worked from nine to five.

English: Don't interrupt me.

English: I can't come tonight.

English: You go first.

English: I can't describe how I felt.

English: I don't know what that word means.

English: I must decline.

English: A student wants to see you.

English: I thought you were injured.

English: Who is the woman in the brown coat?

English: It's the least I could do.

English: You can smoke in this room.

English: You knew I was married.

English: You should have visited Kyoto.

English: Shut the door, please.

English: You were alone at that time, weren't you?

English: They're headed this way.

English: Where can I buy silk?

English: Tom is good at mathematics.
French: Tom est bon en mathématiques.

English: Nobody believes me.

English: That's one of them.

English: No matter how sneaky you are, you can never surprise yourself.
French: Tout sournois que vous soyez, vous ne pouvez jamais vous surprendre vous-mêmes.

English: The Amazon is the second longest river in the world after the Nile.
French: L'Amazone est le deuxième plus long fleuve du monde après le Nil.

English: They danced until six in the morning.
French: Ils dansèrent jusqu'à six heures du matin.

English: I couldn't have done it without you. Thank you.
French: Je n'aurais pas pu le faire sans toi. Merci.

English: Her feelings are easily hurt.

English: We were surprised by his behavior.
French: Nous avons été surpris par son comportement.

English: She was about to go out.
French: Elle allait sortir.

English: You have made the very same mistake again.
French: Vous avez exactement refait la même erreur.

English: I'm not available right now.

English: Mistakes like these are easily overlooked.

English: Thank you for the wonderful meal.
French: Merci pour ce merveilleux repas.

English: Do you like my new haircut?

English: There were many things that needed to be done before we could leave.
French: De nombreuses choses étaient à faire avant que nous puissions partir.

English: I feel giddy.

English: Yesterday my bicycle was stolen while I was doing some shopping.
French: Hier, on m'a volé mon vélo pendant que je faisais du shopping.

English: I go out with Mary almost every Saturday.
French: Je sors avec Mary presque tous les samedis.

English: We finally have you where we want you.
French: Nous vous avons finalement mené là où nous vous voulons.

English: I suppose he's got a point.
French: Je suppose qu'il a raison.

English: We will win the battle.
French: Nous gagnerons la bataille.

English: It's a pleasure to finally meet you.
French: C'est un plaisir que de finalement vous rencontrer.

English: Let's go by bus.
French: Rendons-nous y en bus.

English: I had no idea you were involved.
French: Je n'avais pas idée que tu étais impliquée.

English: This sofa can seat three people easily.
French: Trois personnes peuvent facilement s'asseoir dans ce canapé.

English: What's Tom's real name?
French: Quel est le vrai nom de Tom ?

English: Have you ever eaten at that restaurant?
French: Avez-vous jamais mangé à ce restaurant ?

English: Can I watch your next game?
French: Puis-je regarder ton prochain jeu ?

English: Our family has lived here for generations.
French: Notre famille a vécu ici durant des générations.

English: She can't swim.
French: Elle n'est pas capable de nager.

English: Here's where it gets tricky.
French: C'est ici que ça devient délicat.

English: I don't approve your decision.
French: Je n'approuve pas votre décision.

English: It's not real money.
French: Ce n'est pas du véritable argent.

English: Don't worry. Everything will be fine.
French: Ne te fais pas de souci ! Tout ira bien.

English: Do you need to drink wine?
French: As-tu besoin de boire du vin ?

English: You know what you must do.
French: Vous savez ce que vous devez faire.

English: I want something to read on the train.
French: J'ai envie de lire quelque chose dans le train.

English: I never thought of that.
French: Je n'ai jamais pensé à ça.

English: You only have to ask for it.
French: Il vous suffit juste de le demander.

English: Don't you have work to do?

English: My mother can't come.
French: Ma mère ne peut pas venir.

English: When did you see him?

English: She's busy now, so she can't talk with you.
French: Elle est occupée à l'heure qu'il est, donc elle ne peut pas te parler.

English: How late do you stay open?
French: Jusqu'à quelle heure restez-vous ouvert ?

English: You ain't seen nothing yet.
French: T'as encore rien vu.

English: I feel very chilly.
French: Je suis gelée.

English: The baby cried.
French: Le bébé a pleuré.

English: Do you remember us?
French: Te souviens-tu de nous ?

English: Neither is true.
French: Aucun des deux n'est vrai.

English: My girlfriend is Chinese.
French: Ma petite copine est chinoise.

English: That distinction was well-deserved.
French: Cette distinction a été fort méritée.

English: He chose a good wife.
French: Il a choisi une bonne épouse.

English: They are all alike to me.
French: Ils sont tous semblables à moi.

English: Do you want to leave it like that?
French: Veux-tu le laisser ainsi ?

English: The shower is broken.
French: La douche ne fonctionne pas.

English: Help me.
French: Aidez-moi.

English: Tom backed out at the last moment.
French: Tom y a renoncé au dernier moment.

English: I didn't know you were awake.
French: J'ignorais que vous étiez éveillés.

English: You were there, weren't you?
French: Vous étiez là, n'est-ce pas ?

English: Tom was apparently murdered while he was sleeping.
French: Tom aurait été assassiné alors qu'il dormait.

English: When I was your age, I had a job.
French: Lorsque j'avais ton âge, j'avais un boulot.

English: I finally caught up with my friends.
French: Je rattrapai finalement mes amis.

English: I haven't gotten paid yet.
French: Je n'ai pas encore été payée.

English: I'll certainly miss him.
French: Il me manquera certainement.

English: Can you see Tom?
French: Peux-tu voir Tom ?

English: I was surprised by Tom's strength.
French: J'ai été surpris par la force de Tom.

English: I'm pretty sure Tom lives on Park Street.
French: Je suis presque sûre que Tom habite à Park Street.

English: He likes country music.
French: Il aime la musique country.

English: I still have a lot of time for fun.
French: Je dispose d'encore beaucoup de temps pour m'amuser.

English: I knew it wouldn't work.
French: Je savais que ça ne fonctionnerait pas.

English: It's not a secret.
French: Ce n'est pas un secret.

English: Tom seems lost.
French: Tom semble perdu.

English: I don't believe you anymore.
French: Je ne te crois plus.

English: I don't really need your help.

English: I don't care how much you want it. I'm not going to give it to you.
French: Je me fiche de combien tu le veux. Je ne vais pas te le donner.

English: It's not easy.
French: Ce n'est pas facile.

English: You shouldn't laugh at his mistakes.
French: Tu ne devrais pas rire de ses erreurs.

English: Can I use a credit card?

English: My hobby is cooking.
French: Mon passe-temps est la cuisine.

English: It's secret.
French: C'est secret.

English: We'll convince Tom.
French: Nous convaincrons Tom.

English: We're on schedule.
French: On est dans les clous.

English: I managed to finish the work.
French: J'ai réussi à finir le travail.

English: I'd be curious to know what Tom has to say.
French: Je serais curieux de savoir ce que Tom a à dire.

English: It's sad.
French: C’est triste.

English: I'll be with you in a sec.
French: Je serai avec vous dans une seconde.

English: She seems to have a tendency to exaggerate things.
French: Elle a l'air d'avoir tendance à exagérer.

English: Is Tom about to sing?
French: Tom est-il sur le point de chanter ?

English: Did they say why?

English: I thought I heard you.
French: Je pensais que je t'avais entendue.

English: This is not the entrance.
French: Ce n'est pas l'entrée.

English: Was it all a dream?
French: Tout était-il un rêve ?

English: Is tomorrow a holiday?
French: C'est férié, demain ?

English: They're still young.
French: Elles sont encore jeunes.

English: You are such a liar!
French: Tu es une de ces menteuses !

English: I want this one myself.
French: Moi je veux celui-ci !

English: There is an urgent need for better communication.
French: Il y a un besoin urgent de meilleure communication.

English: You shouldn't read such useless books.
French: Tu ne devrais pas lire de livres aussi inutiles.

English: Could you please tell me how to get to the station?

English: Tighten this screw.
French: Resserre cette vis !

English: It's all right.
French: Ce n'est pas grave.

English: What medicine do you recommend?

English: I'm glad to see you here.
French: Je me réjouis de te voir ici.

English: I left Tom a message this morning.
French: J'ai laissé un message à Tom ce matin.

English: A permanent costs extra.

English: He got ahead of me.

English: I suggest we drink as little as possible to be polite.

English: I like to clean my room.

English: There were 215 votes for the motion and 15 votes against it.
French: Il y a eu deux-cent-quinze voix en faveur de la motion et quinze contre.

English: Why are you waiting here?

English: To my knowledge, she hasn't married yet.
French: À ma connaissance, elle n'est pas encore mariée.

English: I bought an eight-acre farm for my retirement.

English: I'll guide you.

English: Sit down to put your boots on.
French: Assieds-toi pour mettre tes bottes.

English: When he spoke, everyone became silent.

English: Don't tell me. Let me guess.

English: Don't smoke in this room.

English: Don't you get it?

English: I don't know if he knows it.

English: I need air.

English: Tom fell asleep while he was driving and caused an accident.

English: Are we prepared?

English: I want to give you some money to help you through these hard times.
French: Je veux te donner de l'argent pour t'aider à traverser ces temps difficiles.

English: I didn't even notice you.

English: He is a very irritating critic of others.
French: Il est un critique des autres très irritant.

English: We must hurry.

English: A business cycle is a recurring succession of periods of prosperity and periods of depression.
French: Le cycle d'une entreprise est une succession de périodes de prospérité et de dépression.

English: Everybody makes mistakes once in a while.
French: Tout le monde commet des erreurs, de temps à autre.

English: He resigned as president.
French: Il a démissionné de son poste de président.

English: I think I can do better.

English: I haven't seen you for a while.

English: Easy does it.

English: He sleeps during the day and works at night.
French: Il dort durant le jour et travaille de nuit.

English: I would like to have a cup of coffee.
French: J'aimerais prendre une tasse de café.

English: Children should not be spoiled.

English: Don't forget to pay the phone bill.
French: N'oublie pas de payer la facture de téléphone.

English: You can trust them.
French: On peut leur faire confiance.

English: A leap year has three hundred and sixty-six days.
French: Une année bissextile a trois cent soixante-six jours.

English: It is certain that he will come here.
French: Il est certain qu'il viendra ici.

English: We'll never forget your kindness.

English: I looked for a place to crash.

English: She looked at him with hatred.
French: Elle l'a regardé avec haine.

English: In terms of salary, that job is fantastic.
French: En termes de salaire, le poste est super.

English: That was exactly what she intended.
French: C'était exactement son intention.

English: I loved working here with you.
French: J'ai adoré travailler ici avec toi.

English: I like Boston a lot.
French: J'aime beaucoup Boston.

English: Let's talk.

English: He gave me some stamps.
French: Il m'a donné des timbres.

English: I'm innocent.

English: I think he likes you.

English: I couldn't take your place.

English: A cat came out from under the desk.

English: I ran into an old friend of mine this morning.
French: Je suis tombé ce matin sur un vieil ami à moi.

English: Stop being so naive.
French: Arrêtez d'être si naïves.

English: I met some friends while I was waiting for a bus.
French: J'ai rencontré des amies tandis que j'attendais un bus.

English: I have completely recovered.

English: Call a doctor immediately.
French: Appelle un médecin immédiatement.

English: They made fun of my clothes.

English: I don't like that either.

English: Japan has enjoyed prosperity since the war.
French: Le Japon a prospéré après la guerre.

English: As far as I know, he won't come.

English: I'm just beginning.

English: We all have kids.
French: Nous avons toutes des gosses.

English: A doctor told me that eating eggs was bad for me.
French: Un docteur m'a dit que manger des œufs était mauvais pour ma santé.

English: I hate that guy.

English: Everyone's watching.

English: She said that she would follow him no matter where he went.
French: Elle déclara qu'elle le suivrait où qu'il aille.

English: We're really scared.

English: That's not all that happened.
French: Ce n'est pas tout ce qui s'est produit.

English: What makes you so sure Tom was the one who stole your bicycle?
French: Comment peux-tu être sûr que c'est Tom qui a volé le vélo ?

English: You know too much.
French: Tu en sais trop.

English: My favorite flavor is chocolate.
French: Ma saveur préférée, c'est le chocolat.

English: He came to my house.
French: Il vint chez moi.

English: There's food in the fridge.
French: Il y a de la nourriture au réfrigérateur.

English: I fell into the water.
French: Je suis tombé dans l'eau.

English: You're wasting both of our time.
French: Tu gaspilles notre temps à tous les deux.

English: Help me!

English: You'd better go.
French: Il vaut mieux que vous y alliez.

English: Are you going to be home for Christmas?

English: Let's shake hands and be friends.
French: Serrons-nous la main et soyons amis.

English: I want what you want.

English: I thought you'd never call.
French: Je pensais ne jamais vous avoir.

English: Tom tried to conceal the truth.
French: Tom a essayé de cacher la vérité.

English: The planes flew over the village.
French: Les avions volèrent au-dessus du village.

English: He survived the accident.
French: Il a survécu à l'accident.

English: Be ruthless.
French: Soyez impitoyables !

English: The school rules require students to wear school uniforms.
French: Le règlement de l'école prévoit le port d'un uniforme par les élèves.

English: Tom is a preacher.
French: Tom est un donneur de leçons.

English: I never liked school.
French: Je n'ai jamais aimé l'école.

English: Tom stayed in Boston for three days.
French: Tom resta à Boston pendant trois jours.

English: I deserved it.

English: I'm very sleepy now.

English: The same holds true for Germany.

English: I love seeing you so happy.

English: His story was published in a magazine.
French: Son histoire fut publiée dans un magazine.

English: This reminds me of Tom.
French: Ça me rappelle Tom.

English: You knew this would happen, didn't you?

English: Do you think that Tom is happy?

English: I have been a teacher for 15 years.
French: Ça fait quinze ans que je suis professeur.

English: The previous tenant took excellent care of her apartment.
French: La locataire précédente a pris grand soin de son appartement.

English: Come whenever you want to.

English: I told him, once for all, that I would not marry him.
French: Je lui ai dit, une fois pour toutes, que je ne me marierai pas avec lui.

English: Why don't you take a break?

English: I can smell cookies.

English: Why don't you have a girlfriend?

English: Did Tom drown?

English: My explanation may sound strange.
French: Mon explication peut sembler étrange.

English: It sounds good to me.
French: Ça me semble bon.

English: Five minutes' walk brought us to the park.
French: Cinq minutes de marche nous amenèrent au parc.

English: Do you spend more time with your friends or with your family?
French: Passes-tu davantage de temps avec tes amies ou avec ta famille ?

English: My three-year-old niece kissed me on the cheek.
French: Ma nièce de trois ans m'a embrassé sur la joue.

English: Are you flirting with me?

English: How do we stop it?

English: They're right behind you.

English: If only I hadn't been in such a hurry!

English: I think it wouldn't be too hard to come up with a better system.

English: You're very good.

English: She has no one to turn to.

English: You shall have my answer tomorrow.

English: Knowing is one thing, teaching quite another.
French: Savoir est une chose, enseigner en est complètement une autre.

English: Tom came to my office to ask me for money.
French: Tom est venu dans mon bureau pour me demander de l'argent.

English: Mother insists that I should eat more vegetables.
French: Ma mère insiste sur le fait que je devrais manger plus de légumes.

English: Which is your suitcase?

English: We came to the conclusion that he should be fired.
French: Nous sommes arrivés à la conclusion qu'il devrait être licencié.

English: You were very busy, weren't you?
French: Vous étiez très occupées, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I've never been so proud.
French: Je n'ai jamais été si fier.

English: What have you heard?
French: Qu'as-tu entendu ?

English: Black smoke spewed out of the third-story windows.
French: De la fumée noire s'exhalait par les fenêtres du troisième étage.

English: Come on.

English: I am too tired to keep on walking.

English: I wish they would stop fighting.

English: Japanese children are group members even when they are sleeping.
French: Les enfants japonais sont des membres du groupe, même quand ils dorment.

English: I like to travel alone.
French: J'aime voyager seul.

English: I don't know what else to try.
French: Je ne sais quoi essayer d'autre.

English: How many ways are there to do that?

English: Did you see that car?

English: Was there much damage?

English: I can't believe I just shot myself.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que je vienne de me tirer dessus.

English: We went to the beach to swim.
French: Nous sommes allés à la plage pour nager.

English: Who unplugged the TV?

English: He is very brave.
French: Il est très courageux.

English: We're doing what we want to do.
French: Nous sommes en train de faire ce que nous voulons faire.

English: I've been watching you study.

English: I wish you had come with us.
French: J'aurais aimé que tu vinsses avec nous.

English: Letters are delivered every day.
French: Le courrier est distribué chaque jour.

English: She died on a cold night in December.
French: Elle mourut par une froide nuit de décembre.

English: Don't leave without saying goodbye.
French: Ne pars pas sans dire au revoir.

English: How am I still alive?

English: She went shopping at a supermarket.
French: Elle est allée faire les courses au supermarché.

English: They are engaged in cancer research.
French: Elles se sont engagées dans la recherche sur le cancer.

English: How did we get into so much trouble?

English: Tom got permission to go home early.
French: Tom a obtenu la permission de rentrer tôt.

English: In addition to English, he speaks German.
French: En plus de l'anglais, il parle aussi l'allemand.

English: He likes me.

English: He is not much better, and there is a little hope of recovery.
French: Il ne va pas mieux et il y a peu de chance de guérison.

English: We need everything.

English: Yes. You're absolutely right.
French: Oui. Tu as parfaitement raison.

English: I hope you have insurance.
French: J'espère que tu es couvert par une assurance.

English: I question your loyalty.

English: I was thinking about going to that new place on Park Street.
French: Je pensais aller à ce nouveau lieu sur la rue Park.

English: Vandalism is on the rise.

English: She became a mother when she was fifteen years old.
French: Elle devint mère à l'âge de 15 ans.

English: We can all dream.

English: You should have told him.

English: I wasn't talking to you.

English: Have you ever been kissed before?

English: Nothing is more important than health.
French: Rien n'est plus important que la santé.

English: He is beginning to lose his hair.

English: I can't wait for tomorrow to come.

English: As soon as he was left alone, he opened the letter.
French: Dès qu’il fut seul, il ouvrit la lettre.

English: I'm doing it in spite of you.

English: Fishing is fun.

English: Not everyone enjoyed it.

English: How long will it stop there?

English: Everyone makes mistakes.

English: I had to do what I did.

English: It's a nice country to visit, but I wouldn't live there.

French: Si vous voulez cet emploi, vous devez postuler avant demain.

English: Tom never gets invited to parties.
French: Tom n'est jamais invité à des fêtes.

English: Tom was here a minute ago.

English: He took a quick look at the magazine.

English: Anticipating a cold winter, we bought a bigger stove.
French: Anticipant un hiver froid, nous avons acheté un poêle plus grand.

English: Do you have enough money to buy one?
French: As-tu assez d'argent pour en acheter une ?

English: I need you to take in the hem by about an inch.

French: Sa tentative d'évasion fut couronnée de succès.

English: The time women spend doing housework is now a lot less than it used to be.
French: Le temps que les femmes passent à effectuer des tâches ménagères est désormais bien moindre qu'auparavant.

English: I can't understand why she doesn't love me anymore.

English: It's getting darker and darker.

English: I want to move out of this cramped room as soon as I can.
French: Je veux sortir de cette pièce confinée dès que possible.

French: Selon une étude récente, la durée de vie moyenne des Japonais est en constante augmentation.

English: He was very tall, so I recognized him at once.
French: Il était très grand, aussi je le reconnus tout de suite.

English: He has become thin beyond all recognition.
French: Il a tellement maigri qu'on ne le reconnait plus.

English: What if you gave a speech and nobody came?
French: Et si tu faisais un discours et que personne ne venait ?

English: I'd like you to have this.
French: J'aimerais que vous ayez ceci.

English: It's not your style.

English: We've just spent two weeks apart.
French: Nous venons de passer deux semaines séparés.

English: I was more than a little shocked by this.
French: Je fus plus qu'un peu choqué par cela.

English: Is that normal?

English: Are you free tonight?

English: I don't want to go to school.

English: I advise you to be punctual.
French: Je vous conseille d'être ponctuelles.

English: We got off on the wrong foot.

English: The police told the demonstrators that they'd be arrested if they didn't move immediately.
French: La police indiqua aux manifestants qu'ils seraient arrêtés s'ils ne bougeaient pas immédiatement.

English: I'm not surprised.
French: Je ne suis pas surprise.

English: I'd like to visit England someday.
French: Un jour, j'aimerais visiter l'Angleterre.

English: Mary had a girls' night out.
French: Marie a passé une soirée entre filles.

English: That's not what happened.
French: Ce n'est pas ce qui s'est produit.

English: The bridge is approximately a mile long.
French: Le pont fait approximativement un mile de long.

English: Which book is better?

English: I was expecting you.

English: I really want you to hug me.
French: Je veux vraiment que vous me serriez dans vos bras.

English: I'd like to get started.
French: J'aimerais commencer.

English: I can't stand his behavior anymore.
French: Je ne peux supporter son comportement plus longtemps.

English: Portugal has decriminalized the possession of drugs for personal use.
French: Le Portugal a dépénalisé la possession de drogues à usage personnel.

English: She takes piano lessons once a week.
French: Elle prend des leçons de piano une fois par semaine.

English: Tom lived in that small house for a little over ten years.
French: Tom a vécu dans cette petite maison pendant un peu plus de dix ans.

English: If you could manage to go camping with us, we'd be delighted.
French: Si vous faisiez en sorte de venir camper avec nous, nous serions ravis.

English: I'll find out soon enough.
French: Je le découvrirai bien assez tôt.

English: He learned golf by watching others and following their example.
French: Il a appris le golf en regardant les autres et en suivant leur exemple.

English: Tom knew who Mary's boyfriend was.
French: Tom savait qui était le copain de Mary.

English: He is no longer welcome here.

English: I'm glad we did that.

English: You're the oldest.

English: Can I buy you another beer?

English: We sure had fun, didn't we?
French: Nous nous sommes vraiment bien amusées, non ?

English: You're overconfident.
French: Tu as trop confiance en toi.

English: Are you fond of music?
French: Est-ce que tu aimes la musique ?

English: Everyone jumped into the pool.
French: Tout le monde a sauté dans la piscine.

English: Fire is always dangerous.
French: Le feu sera toujours dangereux.

English: It was just a matter of time.
French: Ce fut juste une question de temps.

English: Come and have tea with me.
French: Venez prendre le thé avec moi.

English: Have you seen enough?

English: How are things going with your youngest sister?
French: Comment ça marche pour ta petite sœur ?

English: Does she have a boyfriend?

English: I don't know what would happen if I ever lost you.
French: Je ne sais pas ce qu'il se passerait si jamais je te perdais.

English: That is not how we do things here.
French: Ce n'est pas la manière que nous avons de faire les choses, ici.

English: I don't see anybody inside.
French: Je ne vois personne à l'intérieur.

English: Tom behaved badly.
French: Tom s'est mal comporté.

English: Did you hurt yourself?

English: Please write your contact address here.
French: Veuillez écrire ici votre adresse de contact.

English: I can assure you that you are wrong.
French: Je peux t'assurer que tu as tort.

English: Who's taking responsibility for the loss?

English: Would you consider taking care of my children next Saturday?
French: Pourrais-tu réfléchir à t'occuper de mes enfants samedi prochain ?

English: What is the name of that bird?
French: Comment se nomme cet oiseau ?

English: I would like to charter a yacht.
French: J'aimerais bien affréter un yacht.

English: I feel powerless.
French: Je me sens impuissant.

English: Add 5 to 3 and you have 8.
French: Cinq plus trois égalent huit.

English: She admitted that she was wrong.
French: Elle admit qu'elle avait tort.

English: Do you work here?
French: Tu travailles ici ?

English: Was anyone in the room?
French: Quiconque se trouvait-il dans la pièce ?

English: Who deleted the file?
French: Qui a effacé le fichier ?

English: Where is the library?
French: Où se trouve la bibliothèque ?

English: She has remained abroad ever since.
French: Elle est restée à l'étranger depuis lors.

English: Tell me what we're doing here.
French: Dis-moi ce que nous faisons ici !

English: Does the applicant have suitable abilities to carry out the job?
French: Le candidat a-t-il les capacités qui conviennent pour mener à bien le travail ?

English: I will take it.
French: Je le prendrai.

English: Will it fit?
French: Cela s'adaptera-t-il ?

English: We're close friends.
French: Nous sommes des amis proches.

English: It's true that she's dead.
French: Il est vrai qu'elle est morte.

English: He was desperate to escape.
French: Il voulait désespérément s'échapper.

English: You're not as good as you think you are.
French: Tu n'es pas aussi bonne que tu penses l'être.

English: It'll take two hours to get there by bus.
French: Cela prendra deux heures d'y arriver en car.

English: What time does your watch say it is now?
French: Quelle heure votre montre indique-t-elle, maintenant ?

English: I don't remember where I put my key.
French: Je ne me rappelle pas où j'ai mis ma clé.

English: Will there be any food at the party?
French: Y aura-t-il la moindre nourriture à la fête ?

English: They saw us yesterday.
French: Elles nous ont vues hier.

English: I ran as fast as I could, but I missed the train.
French: J'ai couru aussi vite que je pouvais mais j'ai manqué le train.

English: He worked very hard.

English: He is as tall as his father.
French: Il est aussi grand que son père.

English: The priest's cassock billowed gently in the wind.
French: La soutane du prêtre gonflait doucement au vent.

English: I will try again.

English: I saw Shin'ichi in Kakogawa yesterday.
French: J'ai vu Shin'ichi à Kakogawa hier.

English: I have to come on Monday.
French: Je dois venir le lundi.

English: I'll give you a lift home.

English: I forgot you were listening.
French: J'ai oublié que tu étais en train d'écouter.

English: We took lots of pictures.
French: Nous avons pris beaucoup de photos.

English: Do you own a gun?
French: Possédez-vous une arme à feu ?

English: What you need is a friend.
French: Ce qu'il vous faut, c'est un ami.

English: I remember meeting her somewhere.
French: Je me souviens de l'avoir rencontrée quelque part.

English: We're sorry.

English: Nothing out of the ordinary happened.

English: Are you feeling under the weather?

English: I think you misunderstood what I said.

English: Please help yourself to some fruit.

English: Don't make me say it.

English: I've made up my mind to give back all the money I stole.

English: This has all been a mistake.

English: What kind of car do you drive?

English: He put on the black coat.

English: I can't believe what I'm hearing.

English: You really should buy a new car.

English: A professional thief can jimmy a car door in no time.

English: Tom was screaming at Mary.

English: We work every day but Sunday.

English: Was it a hard decision?

English: I asked him to be here by six.

English: Can anyone believe you?

English: I'm reading the New York Times.

English: He made reference to the previous director.

English: Why would I want to help Tom?

English: I feel feverish.

English: How about running?

English: He let me go.

English: The man looked at me.

English: Where did I put that box?

English: The bullet penetrated his chest, leaving him in critical condition.
French: La balle pénétra sa poitrine, le laissant dans un état critique.

English: Put the desk against the wall.

English: This book is interesting.

English: I have a right to know.

English: You shouldn't see her now.

English: I don't like any of them.

English: That child wants someone to play with.

English: Tom has red hair.

English: She wished to be beautiful.

English: Sometimes it's hard to resist the impulse to burst out laughing.

English: Production is low.

English: Go and see who it is.

English: Is someone meeting us?

French: Ceci est considéré comme une affaire de grande importance.

English: If my mother had still been alive, she would have helped me at that time.

English: He asked us not to make any noise.
French: Il nous a demandé de ne pas faire de bruit.

English: I can't confirm that.

English: That's a doll.

English: There's nowhere for you to hide.

English: He didn't like school.

English: I don't trust many people.

English: Do you study French every day?

French: Il s'est mis à boire à table depuis ce temps-là

English: I just want you to be involved.

English: He's a stand-up guy.

English: I'm going to be your lawyer.

English: I was very reluctant.

English: It's cold. It was foolish of you not to bring your coat.

French: Plus il gravissait l'échelle sociale, plus modeste il devenait.

English: Tom gave me this watch.

English: I thought I'd never hear that.

English: If you want one, you'll have to find your own.

English: Do you have any vacancies?

English: I'm lonely.

English: We have known each other for years.

English: You are in my way.

English: I just want to go home.

English: Who did you think I was?

English: Tom seems really happy to be here.

English: I appreciate you taking the time to help.

English: I'll never see him again.

English: Is eating meat morally wrong?

English: I first met him three years ago.
French: Je l'ai rencontré pour la première fois il y a trois ans.

English: Follow us.

English: You're stupid to trust him.
French: Tu es stupide de lui faire confiance.

English: What is going on?

English: Are all the windows shut?

English: Tom isn't a huge football fan.
French: Tom n'est pas un grand fan de football.

English: I eat alone.

English: I suggest we swim across the river.
French: Je suggère que nous traversions la rivière à la nage.

English: Don't confuse astrology with astronomy.
French: Ne confonds pas l'astrologie avec l'astronomie.

English: Tom is only three weeks old.

English: I'm normal.

English: I didn't want you involved in this.

English: Please put your baggage on this scale.
French: Veuillez placer vos bagages sur cette balance.

English: He is Canadian.

English: He is an acrobat.

English: You're still young.

English: She is still a girl.
French: Elle est encore mineure.

English: Tom screamed at the top of his lungs.
French: Tom cria de tout son corps.

English: I can't believe you turned down that job.

English: I ran ahead to warn everybody.

English: I want the two of you to quit arguing.

English: What do they call their baby?

English: He is very much interested in Japanese history.
French: Il s'intéresse beaucoup à l'histoire du Japon.

English: Tom and Mary worked out their problems.
French: Tom et Marie ont résolu leurs problèmes.

English: Do you find that washing machine easy to use?
French: Trouvez-vous cette machine à laver facile à utiliser ?

English: Do you know how to play chess?
French: Savez-vous jouer aux échecs ?

English: Are you children all right?

English: She was ready to give him back all his money.
French: Elle était prête à lui rendre tout son argent.

English: My turn finally came.
French: Mon tour vint enfin.

English: I don't worry about that stuff.
French: Je ne m'inquiète pas concernant ce truc

English: I'd like to talk to you when you have some free time.
French: J'aimerais vous causer, lorsque vous aurez du temps disponible.

English: She stared at me.
French: Elle m'a fixé.

English: You can tell me the truth.
French: Tu peux me dire la vérité.

English: The barbells are heavy.
French: Les haltères sont lourds.

English: I felt fear.
French: J'ai ressenti de la peur.

English: Eat and drink.

English: He is a famous composer.

English: You're not being rational.
French: Vous n'êtes pas rationnel.

English: Don't look so sad.
French: N'ayez pas l'air si triste !

English: Cars, buses, and trucks are all vehicles.
French: Les voitures, bus ou camions sont tous des véhicules.

English: According to today's paper, there was a big earthquake in Chile yesterday.
French: D'après le journal, il y a eu un grand tremblement de terre au Chili hier.

English: Tom wouldn't let me call an ambulance so I drove him to the hospital myself.
French: Tom a refusé que j'appelle une ambulance alors je l'ai amené à l'hôpital par moi-même.

English: Did the police arrest Tom?
French: La police a-t-elle arrêté Tom?

English: It's an American company.
French: C'est une société étasunienne.

English: I know the reason why Tom was angry with them.
French: Je sais la raison pour laquelle Tom était en colère contre eux.

English: He pressed the button and waited.
French: Il appuya sur le bouton et attendit.

English: What did he do after that?
French: Qu'a-t-il fait après cela ?

English: I realized what was happening.
French: Je pris conscience de ce qui survenait.

English: Obviously, you volunteered.
French: À l'évidence, vous vous êtes porté volontaire.

English: I thought you had learned that by now.
French: Je pensais que tu avais appris ça à l'heure qu'il est.

English: I saw him jump.
French: Je l'ai vu sauter.

English: Can I give you a little friendly advice?
French: Puis-je vous donner un petit conseil d'ami?

English: I ran so I would be on time.
French: Je courus, afin d'être à l'heure.

English: That sounds depressing.

English: He is heroic.
French: Il est héroïque.

English: I'd like to discuss this with your boss.
French: J'aimerais en discuter avec ta patronne.

English: The dog is as good as dead.
French: Le chien est comme mort.

English: There is no film in this camera.
French: Il n'y a pas de film dans cette caméra.

English: I need to know by tomorrow.
French: J'ai besoin de savoir pour demain.

English: Don't forget to remind me of that.

English: Hold your position.

English: Tell me about it!

English: I'll meet him tomorrow.

English: I like to invent useful things.
French: J'aime inventer des choses utiles.

English: After breakfast, we went for a walk.
French: Après le petit déjeuner nous allâmes faire une promenade.

English: I am divorced.
French: Je suis divorcée.

English: Is it important?

English: He may not be happy.
French: Il n'est peut-être pas heureux.

English: Do you think I should go by myself?

English: I don't think anyone thinks you're crazy.
French: Je ne pense pas que quiconque pense que tu sois fou.

English: I think I'd like to be a better student.

English: There was nothing you could have done.

English: I'm still your friend.

English: There's still so much left to do.

French: Beaucoup de gens qui ont jusqu'à présent dépensé de l'argent à passer du bon temps doivent être plus prudents avec leur argent.

English: I just don't understand you.

English: I itch everywhere.

English: I'd like to see you this afternoon.

English: I've always been a hard worker.

English: We can talk about it in the future.

English: She was fond of talking about herself.

English: We all die.

English: You shall have my answer tomorrow.

English: It'll never work.

English: I can't believe I did this.

English: Don't worry about that now.

English: He removed his shirt.

English: She brought him to our place.

English: I wish I were a little taller.

English: He pretended not to hear his boss.
French: Il fit comme s'il n'entendait pas son patron.

French: Tu peux regarder la télévision après dîner.

English: I'm a little bit hungry.

English: I can remember the warmth of her hands.
French: Je peux me souvenir de la chaleur de ses mains.

English: Did you kiss anybody?

English: Many young people in Spain are unemployed.
French: De nombreux jeunes en Espagne sont sans emploi.

English: They don't sell beer here.
French: Ils ne vendent pas de bière, ici.

English: She is among those unaccounted for.
French: Elle compte parmi ceux dont on est sans nouvelles.

English: Let's drop it.

English: It's only blood.

English: No one believed me.

English: I hope to get away from Tokyo for a few days.
French: J'espère partir de Tokyo pour quelques jours.

English: My great aunt was a staunch teetotaler.
French: Ma grand-tante était une anti-alcoolique invétérée.

English: You can't have left it at the airport.
French: Tu ne peux pas l'avoir laissé à l'aéroport.

English: This button is loose.
French: Ce bouton se détache.

English: You two are really kind.
French: Vous êtes tous les deux vraiment gentils.

English: It's too late.

English: No one is speaking.
French: Personne ne parle.

English: You can tell me anything.
French: Vous pouvez tout me dire.

English: His concert was very good.
French: Son concert était très bon.

English: I don't have them yet.
French: Je ne les ai pas encore.

English: Do you consider them dangerous?
French: Les considères-tu dangereux ?

English: He drinks like a fish.
French: Il boit comme un poisson.

English: The snow stopped falling.
French: La neige cessa de tomber.

English: Life is full of surprises.
French: La vie est pleine de surprises.

English: The hat costs less than the coat.
French: Le chapeau coûte moins que le manteau.

English: Would you like to be seated?

English: Tom is the right man for the job.

English: He runs very fast.

English: Tom isn't a boy anymore.

English: Don't worry. They will be supervised.
French: Ne t'en fais pas. Ils seront supervisés.

French: Je ne peux pas vous raconter ce que Tom m'a dit.

English: We can talk this through.

English: Why didn't you call me last night?
French: Pourquoi ne m'avez-vous pas appelé la nuit dernière ?

English: His unusual behavior aroused our suspicion.
French: Son comportement inhabituel éveilla notre méfiance.

English: The water was hot.

English: I don't know what you're so worried about.

English: Stay out of my business.

French: Il est trop occupé à rêvasser pour projeter ce qu'il fera lorsqu'il sera vieux.

English: I hate this music.

English: I don't want this shirt.
French: Je ne veux pas cette chemise.

English: I think the train will come soon.
French: Je pense que le train va bientôt arriver.

English: He's always at home on Sundays.
French: Il est toujours chez lui le dimanche.

English: Why can't you be more like your brother?
French: Pourquoi ne peux-tu pas ressembler davantage à ton frère ?

English: Strangely enough, he failed.
French: Bizarrement, il a échoué.

English: I wonder if you'd help us.
French: Je me demande si tu nous aiderais.

English: I was very tired.

English: I'm really proud of you.

English: Shut the door.

English: It's a little late for that, isn't it?

English: We missed the deadline.
French: Nous avons loupé la date limite.

French: Amène ta sœur avec toi la prochaine fois.

French: Son oncle est mort il y a cinq ans.

English: I was kidding.

English: Tom's well.

English: I owe you a sincere apology.

English: Let me treat you next time, then.

English: You disgust me.

English: I have proof.

English: He is about to die.

English: I regret doing that.

English: The eating of delicious food is one of the most intense and poignant pleasures of life.
French: La consommation de nourriture délicieuse est l'un des plaisirs de la vie les plus intenses et poignants.

English: I can't really complain.

English: You should wear your hair down more often. It looks great that way.

English: Our city is rather small in comparison with Tokyo.

English: It is getting darker and darker.

English: I had some trouble figuring out the answer.

English: Tom is one of the few people I can trust.

English: We saw Tom talking to Mary in the park this morning.

English: I finally understand the basic principles of calculus.

English: I'm drunk.

English: Join us.

English: There are many mysteries in life.

English: A square has four equal sides.

English: He found a ball in the garden.

English: I really miss my girlfriend.

English: This mink cost $3,000.

English: You aren't invited.

English: I'm adamant that you should go.

English: I'm impressed you've done so well.

English: He doesn't understand you.

English: Did you get good marks?

English: Tom doesn't help me.

English: I'm a musician.

English: I was planning to call him, but changed my mind and didn't.
French: J'avais prévu de l'appeler mais j'ai changé d'avis et je ne l'ai pas fait.

English: I have not seen you for ages.

English: Is it large enough?

English: You were so strong.

English: Tom has three sons, I believe.

English: I don't know how this works.

English: Don't speak to her like that.

English: He always works hard.

English: Keep driving.

English: You are a beautiful butterfly.

English: We need evidence.

English: I didn't know why I wasn't supposed to go to that part of town.
French: J'ignorais pourquoi je n'étais pas censé me rendre dans cette partie de la ville.

English: You're not the first.

English: It is twenty minutes past ten.

English: 1989 was a difficult year.

English: Are you still there?

English: These boxes are made of plastic.

English: It's a pleasure to meet you.

English: What are your plans for this weekend?

English: How beautiful she is!

English: Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.

English: You may have that opportunity.

English: You don't have to be so sarcastic.

English: You can't learn a foreign language in just a couple of weeks.

English: I know you did it.

English: I'm sort of an extrovert.

English: I don't know the answer to that.

French: Il se comporte comme s'il était fou.

French: Il atteignit finalement son objectif.

English: You are big.

French: Ton petit déjeuner est prêt. Ne le laisse pas refroidir.

English: Tom's arm brushed against mine.
French: Le bras de Tom frôla le mien.

English: He makes a point of doing ten push-ups before going to bed.
French: Il met un point d'honneur à faire dix pompes avant d'aller se coucher.

French: J'ai toujours rêvé d'avoir ma propre entreprise.

English: I don't need this anymore.

French: Nous sommes en train de réaménager notre cuisine.

French: Tom croyait que John était son frère.

English: I'll look after your child while you are away.

English: I'm at your service.

English: I can't put up with this noise anymore.

English: I'd like to know what it is.

English: You don't like chocolate, do you?

English: You have done very well.

English: He left his wife.
French: Il a quitté sa femme.

English: They're right behind you.

English: Where is it hidden?

English: You must make allowance for his lack of experience.

English: I called her, but the line was busy.

French: Mon oncle me demanda ce que j'avais l'intention d'être quand je serai diplômé du collège.

English: Could you lower your voice please? I'm really hung over.
French: Tu pourrais parler moins fort s'il te plaît ? J'ai une de ces gueule de bois ...

French: Elle ne sait pas faire de la bicyclette.

English: What are your plans for the weekend?
French: Quels sont tes plans pour le week-end ?

English: I love trying out new things, so I always buy products as soon as they hit the store shelves. Of course, half the time I end up wishing I hadn't.
French: J'adore essayer de nouvelles choses, alors j'achète toujours des produits dès qu'ils sont en rayons. Bien sûr, la moitié du temps, je finis par souhaiter ne pas l'avoir fait.

English: We talked.

English: It won't cost you a dime.

English: I don't want to talk to you about this.

English: I really like it, too.

English: Can you make it go any faster?

English: Strange to say, he didn't know the news.
French: C'est étrange à dire, mais il ne connaissait pas la nouvelle.

English: I've won first prize!

English: I didn't want to bug you.

English: What're you doing here?

English: Her name wasn't on the list.
French: Son nom ne figurait pas dans la liste.

English: Everyone knows what they have to do, right?
French: Chacun sait ce qu'il a à faire, n'est-ce pas ?
