English: I bet you didn't see that coming.
French: Je parie que vous n'avez pas vu ça venir.

English: I just got a call from my office.
French: Je viens d'avoir un appel de mon bureau.

English: He got the first prize in the contest.
French: Il gagna le premier prix de la compétition.

English: I don't expect you to understand it.
French: Je ne m'attends pas à ce que tu le comprennes.

English: I think you ought to postpone the meeting.
French: Je pense que vous devriez décaler la réunion.

English: Put the flour on the shelf.
French: Mets la farine sur l'étagère.

English: Don't move, please.
French: Ne bougez pas, s'il vous plait.

English: She will be here this evening.
French: Elle sera là ce soir.

English: As long as I know the money is safe, I will not worry about it.
French: Pour autant que je sache, l'argent est en sécurité ; je ne m'en préoccuperais pas.

English: Do you like me, too?
French: M'appréciez-vous aussi ?

English: She will be here before long.
French: Elle sera là dans peu de temps.

English: Don't ever talk to me again.
French: Ne me parlez jamais plus !

English: He ogled a girl outside a pub.
French: Il lorgna une fille à l'extérieur d'un pub.

English: Tom doesn't think that it'll rain tomorrow.
French: Tom ne pense pas qu'il va pleuvoir demain.

English: What was the first instrument you learned to play?
French: Quel était le premier instrument auquel vous avez appris à jouer ?

English: She was indignant at the way she had been treated.
French: Elle fut indignée par la manière avec laquelle elle a été traitée.

English: Did you get the check?
French: As-tu reçu la note ?

English: It's great to meet you.
French: C'est super de te rencontrer.

English: It was after a meeting in America that he decided to write a book for non-scientists.
French: C'était après une réunion en Amérique qu'il décida d'écrire un livre pour les non-initiés.

English: There was a sign saying, "Keep off the grass."
French: Il y avait un panneau disant "Pelouse interdite".

English: Every crime must be punished.
French: Chaque crime doit être puni.

English: My uncle comes back from America next Monday.
French: Mon oncle revient d'Amérique lundi prochain.

English: I'll have you committed.
French: Je te ferai enfermer.

English: Be sure to put out the fire before you leave.
French: Assurez-vous d'éteindre le feu avant que vous ne partiez.

English: To make a long story short, he married his first love.
French: Pour faire court, il a épousé son premier amour.

English: He listened, but heard nothing.
French: Il a écouté, mais n'a rien entendu.

English: I'm not to be disturbed.
French: Qu'on ne me dérange pas !

English: Are you free for dinner tonight?
French: Êtes-vous libre pour souper, ce soir ?

English: All my friends like Tom.
French: Tous mes amis aiment Tom.

English: He admitted his guilt.
French: Il reconnut sa culpabilité.

English: You'd better tell the truth.
French: Tu ferais mieux de dire la vérité.

English: The Giants beat the Lions yesterday.
French: Les Géants ont battu les Lions, hier.

English: He waited his turn.
French: Il attendait son tour.

English: She understands music.
French: Elle comprend la musique.

English: He made up his mind to go there.
French: Il se décida à y aller.

English: You have beautiful hands.
French: Tu as de belles mains.

English: It is difficult to shoot a bird flying in the air.
French: C'est difficile de tirer sur un oiseau en plein vol.

English: Tell me about it. I'm all ears.
French: Racontez-moi cela, je suis toute ouïe.

English: We've painted the walls white.
French: Nous avons peint les murs en blanc.

English: That's fun.
French: C'est marrant.

English: My parents will be home about 2:30.
French: Mes parents seront à la maison vers 14h30.

English: I don't want you to go home.
French: Je ne veux pas que tu ailles chez toi.

English: I fed the dog.
French: Je nourris le chien.

English: They carried water in buckets.
French: Elles portèrent l'eau dans des seaux.

English: Tom was the only one who laughed.
French: Tom fut le seul à rire.

English: Harvard was founded in 1636.
French: Harvard fut fondé en 1636.

English: Bears like to scratch their back on tree bark.
French: Les ours aiment se gratter le dos sur l'écorce des arbres.

English: I like your place.
French: J'aime votre appartement.

English: Drink up your milk.
French: Bois ton lait.

English: He was not at all satisfied.
French: Il n'était pas du tout satisfait.

English: It works.

English: We were driven to the wall.
French: Nous étions acculés.

English: Some of us might be willing to go.

English: Sorry, something went wrong.
French: Désolée, quelque chose est allé de travers.

English: You know what you must do.

English: There's no door.
French: Il n'y a pas de porte.

English: I was young and stupid.
French: J'étais jeune et idiot.

English: No one ran ahead of him.
French: Personne ne courait devant lui.

English: Please think about the problem.
French: Veuillez réfléchir à la question.

English: Let's go.

English: I'm content with my salary.
French: Je suis satisfait de mon salaire.

English: I forgot to telephone him today.
French: J'ai oublié de lui téléphoner aujourd'hui.

English: I was afraid that I might hurt his feelings.

English: He never loses hope.

English: Space travel will be commonplace some time in the future.

English: You're going to have to do better than that.

English: I'm not sure of anything.

English: I'm going to take care of it for you.

English: What Tom did was incredibly stupid.

English: If I were you, I would follow his advice.

English: You are not a child anymore.

English: How long have you been abroad?

English: Napoleon was exiled to the island of Elba in 1814.

English: You must be blind as a bat if you couldn't see it.

English: We miss you very much.

English: That's more like it.

English: It appears that the victim tried to write the murderer's name with his own blood.

English: There was no response to my question.

English: She got caught.

English: I'm certain that he'll come.

English: Did you enjoy yourself yesterday?

English: It could be anybody.

English: I ordered those books from Germany.

English: You need written permission.

English: Your parents can't keep us apart forever.

English: You can trust him.

English: I need someone to hold me and tell me everything will be alright.

English: Do you know how that feels?

English: They're idiots.

English: I drive everywhere.

English: I'm sorry I'm calling you at work.

English: Have a good weekend!

English: Don't ever underestimate Tom.

English: Has he paid back the money you lent him?

English: Does this bus go to the center of town?

English: Do you really think Tom is better than I am?

English: I don't have as much money as you think.

English: I really need it.

English: He let us go.

English: I remember many things.

English: What subject do you like best?

English: I didn't understand any of that.

English: One minute has sixty seconds.

English: Tom and Mary are the only survivors.

English: I didn't want to get out of bed.

English: Tom is a very creative person.

English: To our surprise, she has gone to Brazil alone.

English: I like to take things apart to see what makes them tick.

English: He told me to speak more slowly.

English: Why don't you stay and drink some wine with us?

English: He is a student.

English: A DNA test showed he was innocent.

English: I work for a shipping company.

English: It's not always possible to eat well when you are traveling in this part of the world.
French: Il n'est pas toujours possible de bien manger lorsqu'on voyage dans cette partie du monde.

English: No one is invulnerable.

English: You attach too much importance to what he says.

English: Some people are fascinated by shiny new things.
French: Certaines personnes sont fascinées par les nouvelles choses étincelantes.

English: This is a newspaper.

English: Tom's bedroom door was closed.
French: La porte de la chambre de Tom était fermée.

English: I didn't talk to anybody.

English: Wring those clothes well before you hang them up.

English: Break it up!

English: I've upset you.

English: I want to start now.

English: Everything went horribly wrong.

English: Are you seriously thinking about buying that old car?

English: Can you guess what I have?

English: Exercise outdoors.

English: Tom is there.

English: My primary concern is your safety.
French: Mon premier souci est votre sécurité.

English: We must talk.

English: Apart from his parents, no one knows him very well.
French: Personne ne le connaît très bien à part ses parents.

English: I did something I regretted doing.

English: This room smells musty.

English: It's hot out here.

English: I know you've got a gun.

English: He left for London yesterday.

English: What's the purpose of your trip?

English: When will it happen?

English: You might be interested in this.

English: Tell me it's not true.

English: He got up earlier than usual.

English: I really think you should stop doing that.

English: I think life is what you make it.

English: I can't tell you how happy I am that you've come to visit us.

English: This is what I was looking for.

English: They're not evil.

English: Tell Tom I'm on my way.

English: This is not a tiger.

English: The game is not over.

English: They're animals.

English: You're probably too young to understand this.

English: There's a pyramid in Mexico bigger than any of those in Egypt.

English: Tom seems slightly confused.

English: You can't wear that.

English: Do you have any food allergies?

English: How can I get to the police station?

English: Osaka is the second largest city of Japan.
French: Osaka est la deuxième plus grande ville du Japon.

English: Have you heard from him?

English: Are you going to do something about it?

English: This is the worst thing I've ever done.

English: It was quite funny.

English: Don't give up hope.

English: You're going to ruin your eyes.

English: I can't tell you any more, I've already said too much.

English: France was at war with Russia.

English: I guess that's OK.

English: I want something to drink.

English: Did you bring a weapon?

English: His lack of technical knowledge kept him from being promoted.

English: This chair is very comfortable, but I don't like the color.

English: I should get back upstairs.

English: People with rheumatoid arthritis symptoms should be careful about what they eat.

English: He has access to the American Embassy.

English: He came into the room.

English: You love your wife, right?

English: When I'm with you, I'm happy.

English: I'm not a monster.

English: We'll talk in my office.

English: The company suffered big losses.
French: L'entreprise a subi de grosses pertes.

English: Do you think students are given enough time to eat lunch?

English: I may as well go now.

English: What is the name of this river?

English: No one could deny this.

English: Do come and visit us.
French: Venez nous rendre visite !

English: There are few mistakes in your report.

English: We are even.

English: I really appreciate your coming.

English: I saw you at the flower shop.
French: Je vous ai vu au fleuriste.

English: Do you know anyone here?

English: Who will pay?

English: She claims that she knows nothing about him.
French: Elle prétend ne rien savoir à son sujet.

English: Mary is prettier than her sister.
French: Mary est plus jolie que sa sœur.

English: They gave up.

English: You look great.

English: Tell me you're kidding.
French: Dis-moi que tu plaisantes !

English: She allegedly murdered him.
French: Elle l'a prétendument assassiné.

English: I can't do it either.

English: She risked her life to protect her child.
French: Elle a risqué sa vie pour protéger son fils.

English: I have to think.

English: I want to go wherever you're going.

English: I think Tom is in his office.
French: Je pense que Tom est dans son bureau.

English: You sound like a broken record.

English: Why do you have to be like that?

English: That won't make any difference.
French: Ça ne fera aucune différence.

English: I need something for a child.

English: I will definitely attend your funeral.
French: Je prendrai part, sans faute, à ton enterrement.

English: I think I'm in trouble with my wife.
French: Je pense que j'ai des problèmes avec ma femme.

English: I can't answer that question.
French: Je ne peux pas répondre à cette question.

English: You don't have what it takes to be a leader.
French: Tu n’as pas l’étoffe d’un meneur.

English: Do you have anything to do tonight?
French: As-tu quelque chose à faire ce soir ?

English: You were sleeping, weren't you?

English: I'm saving as much as I can.
French: J'économise autant que je peux.

English: It's night.
French: Il fait nuit.

English: It feels silly.
French: Ça semble idiot.

English: I often wrote to her when I was a student.
French: Je lui ai souvent écrit lorsque j'étais étudiant.

English: She turned down his proposal.
French: Elle a décliné sa proposition.

English: Are we being charged with something?
French: Sommes-nous accusés de quelque chose ?

English: I'll be back in time for my mother's birthday.
French: Je serai de retour à temps pour l'anniversaire de ma mère.

English: That day shall come.
French: Ce jour viendra.

English: It's out of the question!
French: C'est hors de question !

English: I never wrote to her, despite the urge to do so.
French: Je ne lui ai jamais écrit, malgré l'envie irrépressible de le faire.

English: I thought I'd surprise you.
French: Je pensais que je vous surprendrais.

English: He cured my illness.
French: Il a soigné ma maladie.

English: I was leaving home when Tom telephoned me.
French: Je partais de chez moi quand Tom me téléphona.

English: You should always save money for a rainy day.
French: Tu devrais toujours économiser de l'argent en prévision de périodes de vaches maigres.

English: Dancing is not a crime.
French: Danser n'est pas un crime.

English: Almost no one thinks that we are sisters.
French: Presque personne ne pense que nous sommes sœurs.

English: He was stunned.
French: Il fut paralysé.

English: You've misunderstood.
French: Tu as compris de travers.

English: I'll meet you at the bus station.
French: Je vais vous rejoindre à la gare routière.

English: He used me as a guinea pig.
French: Il m'a utilisé comme cobaye.

English: Just remember to have fun.
French: Souviens-toi juste de prendre du bon temps.

English: You're just being diplomatic.
French: Tu veux juste paraître diplomate.

English: She advised him not to drive too fast, but he wouldn't listen to her.
French: Elle lui recommanda de ne pas conduire trop vite mais il refusa de l'écouter.

English: Do you have a cellphone?

English: I went on reading.
French: Je poursuivis ma lecture.

English: I pretended it didn't happen.
French: J'ai fait comme si ça n'était pas arrivé.

English: How long can you hold your breath?
French: Combien de temps peux-tu retenir ta respiration ?

English: Watch the front.
French: Surveille le devant.

English: What department do you work for?
French: Dans quel département travaillez-vous ?

English: I can't tell you how happy I am that you've come to visit us.
French: Je ne peux pas vous dire à quel point je suis heureux que vous soyez venus nous rendre visite.

English: Tom and Mary aren't afraid.
French: Tom et Mary ne sont pas effrayés.

English: Please do not try this at home.
French: Je te prie de ne pas tenter cela chez toi.

English: We're here to protect you.
French: Nous sommes là pour te protéger.

English: At last, I caught up with my friends.
French: Enfin, je rattrapai mes amies.

English: We're on a tight schedule today.
French: Nous avons aujourd'hui un emploi du temps chargé.

English: Hand in your homework by next Monday.
French: Remettez vos devoirs pour lundi prochain.

English: I read a lot of magazines.
French: Je lus de nombreux magazines.

English: Why should we harm you?
French: Pourquoi te ferions-nous du mal ?

English: He was born poor, but died a millionaire.
French: Il est né pauvre mais est mort millionnaire.

English: Does anyone know you're here?
French: Quiconque sait-il que vous êtes ici ?

English: How long do I have to wait for the next bus?
French: Combien de temps dois-je attendre pour le prochain bus?

English: They are both good teachers.
French: Ce sont tous les deux de bons professeurs.

English: She has a big family.
French: Elle a une grande famille.

English: Have you ever been lonely?
French: Avez-vous jamais été seuls ?

English: Don't leave me alone, please.
French: S'il te plaît ne me laisse pas toute seule.

English: I said that I was confused.
French: J'ai dit que j'étais désorienté.

English: Don't worry. I'll be right back.
French: Ne vous en faites pas ! Je serai bientôt de retour.

English: I'm as curious as you are.
French: Je suis aussi curieuse que toi.

English: Time travel is impossible.

English: It sickens me.
French: Ça me rend malade.

English: Have you ever eaten a banana pie?

English: Would you be willing to show me how to do that?
French: Serais-tu disposée à me montrer comment le faire ?

English: She's six years older than I am.
French: Elle a six ans de plus que moi.

English: Tom told me you were in Boston.
French: Tom m'a dit que vous étiez à Boston.

English: Could we have a table in the non-smoking section?
French: Pourrions-nous avoir une table dans le coin non-fumeur ?

English: Are you on the committee?
French: Sièges-tu au comité ?

English: We all mourned for the people killed in the accident.

French: Je t'ai vu seul ici et j'ai pensé que tu aimerais peut-être quelqu'un à qui parler.

French: Il ne pouvait pas venir parce qu'il était malade.

English: I received your message yesterday.
French: J'ai reçu ton message hier.

English: Do you enjoy living like this?
French: Prenez-vous plaisir à vivre ainsi ?

English: I can't tell you what I think.
French: Je ne peux pas te dire ce que je pense.

English: Will you watch the Olympics?
French: Regarderez-vous les Jeux Olympiques ?

English: Do you want some coffee?
French: Veux-tu du café ?

English: Roll down your window.
French: Baissez votre fenêtre !

English: Let's hope that's enough time.
French: Espérons que le temps soit suffisant.

English: I submitted the application myself.
French: Je soumis la candidature en personne.

English: Let's see what happens.
French: Voyons ce qui arrive.

English: It's even worse than it looks.
French: C'est même pire que ça en a l'air.

English: It'll work now.
French: Ça fonctionnera dorénavant.

English: I'm having the time of my life.
French: Je m'amuse comme un fou.

English: I wish it were tomorrow already.
French: J'aimerais qu'on soit déjà demain.

English: Do I know him?
French: Je le connais ?

English: Should I start?
French: Devrais-je commencer ?

English: I'm glad to be the one who tells you.
French: Je me réjouis d'être celui qui te l'annonce.

English: My birthday is October 20th.
French: Mon anniversaire est le vingt octobre.

English: I have an important meeting.
French: J'ai une importante réunion.

English: This engine works well.
French: Ce moteur fonctionne bien.

English: We eat many kinds of food.
French: Nous consommons de nombreuses sortes de nourritures.

English: I did not know this.
French: Je ne le savais pas.

English: I fed the leftovers to my dog.
French: J'ai donné les restes à manger à mon chien.

English: They have nothing to eat.
French: Elles n'ont rien à manger.

English: The box is made of wood.
French: La boîte est en bois.

English: Tom certainly got the message.
French: Tom a certainement reçu le message.

English: He saved money for his old age.
French: Il a épargné pour ses vieux jours.

English: That's enough for today.
French: C'est tout pour aujourd'hui.

English: On hearing the news of the birth of his first child, he jumped for joy.
French: À l’annonce de la naissance de son premier enfant, il sauta de joie.

English: I don't think you can beat me.
French: Je ne pense pas que tu puisses me battre.

English: The change was immediate.
French: Le changement fut immédiat.

English: Either they don't want to or they can't.
French: Soit ils ne le veulent pas, soit ils ne le peuvent.

English: I like having breakfast with you.
French: J'aime prendre le petit déjeuner avec vous.

English: The sky is becoming cloudy.
French: Le ciel devient nuageux.

English: He went shopping.
French: Il alla faire des courses.

English: I guess that's good for you.
French: Je suppose que c'est bon pour toi.

English: Will you pick me up at seven tomorrow morning?
French: Viendras-tu me chercher demain matin à sept heures ?

English: He stopped drinking.
French: Il cessa de boire.

English: You're doing it right.
French: Tu le fais comme il faut.

English: I know you recently retired.
French: Je sais que tu es parti en retraite il y a peu.

English: How could you not tell me about this?
French: Comment as-tu pu ne pas m'en parler ?

English: They're keeping it under wraps.
French: Ils le tiennent secret.

English: I'm sorry that I didn't reply sooner.
French: Désolé de ne pas avoir répondu plus tôt.

English: Environmental changes gave rise to new species.
French: Les changements environnementaux donnent naissance à de nouvelles espèces.

English: I'm not surprised you don't know the answer.
French: Je ne suis pas surpris que vous ne connaissiez pas la réponse.

English: Most people only want to hear their own truth.
French: La plupart des gens ne veulent qu'entendre leur propre vérité.

English: I feel so happy when I'm with you.
French: Je me sens tellement heureux lorsque je suis avec vous.

English: He failed the entrance exam.
French: Il a raté l'examen d'entrée.

English: We're slowing down.
French: Nous sommes en train de ralentir.

English: That explains a lot.
French: Ça explique beaucoup de choses.

English: You're very sophisticated.
French: Vous êtes très élégant.

English: I didn't see the fire hydrant.
French: Je n'ai pas vu la bouche d'incendie.

English: Tom couldn't answer Mary's questions.
French: Tom ne pouvait pas répondre aux questions de Mary.

English: Tom's fat, isn't he?
French: Tom est gros, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I met him on the previous day.
French: Je l'ai rencontré la veille.

English: Please pass me the salt.
French: Passez-moi le sel, s'il vous plaît.

English: This medicine does not have side effects.
French: Ce médicament n'a pas d'effets secondaires.

English: I have no clue.
French: Je n'en ai aucune idée.

English: Remain seated, please.
French: Restez assis, je vous prie.

English: He was killed by a land mine.
French: Il a été tué par une mine.

English: Can you make the deadline?
French: Peux-tu tenir le délai ?

English: He is as smart as any other boy in the class.
French: Il est aussi intelligent que n'importe quel autre garçon de la classe.

English: Perhaps you should buy a gun.
French: Peut-être devrais-tu acheter une arme.

English: I had my money stolen.
French: On m'a volé mon argent.

English: I'll come back.
French: Je reviendrai.

English: Are you bored?
French: T'ennuies-tu ?

English: I finally have everything I need.
French: J'ai en définitive tout ce dont j'ai besoin.

English: I played football.
French: J'ai joué au football.

English: German is the best language in the world.
French: L'allemand est la meilleure langue du monde.

English: It needs to be perfectly symmetrical.
French: Ça doit être parfaitement symétrique.

English: You've got the wrong person.
French: Vous avez la mauvaise personne.

English: I thought it best for him to say nothing about the matter.
French: J'ai pensé qu'il était mieux pour lui de ne rien dire à ce sujet.

English: I did it on my own.
French: Je l'ai fait par moi-même.

English: This isn't at all surprising.
French: Ce n'est pas du tout surprenant.

English: I missed my flight.
French: J'ai loupé mon vol.

English: I invited her to a movie.
French: Je l'ai invitée à aller voir un film.

English: Once bitten, twice shy.
French: Chat échaudé craint l'eau froide.

English: Just out of curiosity, what do you expect to happen?
French: Juste par curiosité, qu'attendez-vous qu'il se passe ?

English: I quit smoking.
French: J'ai arrêté de fumer.

English: Am I dreaming?
French: Suis-je en train de rêver ?

English: She told us not to make a noise.
French: Elle nous a dit de ne pas faire un bruit.

English: I saw her spike his drink.
French: Je l'ai vue charger son verre.

English: What should I eat?
French: Que devrais-je manger ?

English: I feel like doing something different today.
French: J'ai envie de faire quelque chose de différent, aujourd'hui.

English: Come here before seven o'clock.
French: Viens ici avant sept heures.

English: Don't mess up my system.
French: Ne fichez pas mon système en l'air !

English: How long were you there?
French: Combien de temps y avez-vous été ?

English: Is your daughter blind?
French: Votre fille est-elle aveugle ?

English: If I were a bird, I could fly to you.
French: Si j'étais un oiseau, je pourrais voler vers toi.

English: I want you to be my friend again.
French: Je veux que tu sois à nouveau mon ami.

English: She was equal to the job.
French: Elle était à la hauteur du boulot.

English: He filed a complaint.
French: Il porta plainte.

English: How many boys are there in the room?
French: Combien de garçons y a-t-il dans la pièce ?

English: Correct me if I'm wrong.
French: Corrigez-moi si je me trompe.

English: He gave his daughter quite a lot of money.
French: Il a donné pas mal d'argent à sa fille.

English: You should try to live within your means.
French: Vous devriez essayer de vivre en fonction de vos moyens.

English: Why don't you eat vegetables?
French: Pourquoi ne mangez-vous pas de légumes ?

English: He ate rice twice a day for many years.
French: Il mangea du riz deux fois par jour pendant de nombreuses années.

English: Our friendship did not last.
French: Notre amitié n'a pas duré.

English: I promise you I'll keep you safe.
French: Je te promets que je te maintiendrai en sécurité.

English: It went OK.
French: Ça s'est bien passé.

English: Wood floats, but iron sinks.
French: Le bois flotte, mais le fer coule au fond.

English: What's all the fuss about?
French: C'est quoi toutes ces histoires ?

English: I hugged her tightly.
French: Je l'ai étroitement enlacée.

English: Dogs are loyal animals.
French: Les chiens sont des animaux loyaux.

English: How many children are there?
French: Combien d'enfants y a-t-il ?

English: Have a nice vacation.
French: Bonnes vacances !

English: Our football team has a good defense.
French: Notre équipe de football a une bonne défense.

English: It's hers.
French: C'est le sien.

English: I'm sorry, but I can't answer right away.
French: Je suis désolé, mais je ne peux pas répondre tout de suite.

English: My girlfriend often cuts my hair.
French: Ma copine me coupe souvent les cheveux.

English: I'm sorry about last night.
French: Je suis désolé à propos de hier au soir.

English: The job offer still stands.
French: L'offre d'emploi est encore ouverte.

English: Tom bought a new tennis racket.
French: Tom a acheté une nouvelle raquette de tennis.

English: You've grown up, Tom.
French: Tu as grandi, Tom.

English: He's dating my daughter.
French: Il sort avec ma fille.

English: We'll miss Tom.
French: Tom va nous manquer.

English: I stayed home all day instead of going to work.
French: Je suis resté à la maison toute la journée au lieu d'aller travailler.

English: I'll drive to Detroit.
French: Je vais conduire jusqu'à Detroit.

English: I ought to have consulted my parents on the matter.
French: J'aurais dû consulter mes parents au sujet de cette affaire.

English: Will you have some coffee?
French: Voulez-vous un peu de café ?

English: Show me how to do that.
French: Montre-moi comment le faire !

English: I promised no such thing.
French: Je n'ai rien promis de tel.

English: Just because something is possible doesn't make it a good idea.
French: Ça n'est pas parce que quelque chose est possible que cela en fait une bonne idée.

English: Leave me alone!
French: Laisse-moi seule !

English: She gave us a vague answer.
French: Elle nous a fourni une vague réponse.

English: A jack of all trades is a master of none.
French: Un homme à tout faire n'est maître d'aucun art.

English: Is anyone else home?
French: Qui que ce soit d'autre se trouve-t-il à la maison ?

English: She always says nice things about him, especially when he's around.
French: Elle dit toujours de chouettes trucs sur lui, particulièrement lorsqu'il est dans les parages.

English: I have no money on me.
French: Je n’ai pas de monnaie sur moi.

English: I'm busy preparing for the trip.
French: Je suis occupé à préparer le voyage.

English: I want to eat something.
French: Je veux manger un truc.

English: I have been here since five o'clock.
French: J'ai été ici depuis cinq heures.

English: Just don't get involved, OK?
French: Ne t'implique simplement pas, d'accord ?

English: I feel like taking a bath now.
French: J'ai envie de prendre un bain, maintenant.

English: You nearly died.
French: Vous êtes presque mortes.

English: Let me pay for your coffee.
French: Laisse-moi payer ton café !

English: Tom hid behind a tree.
French: Tom s'est caché derrière un arbre.

English: I'm sure you won't disappoint me.
French: Je suis certain que vous ne me décevrez pas.

English: I ordered you a drink.
French: Je vous ai commandé un verre.

English: It is necessary for you to stop smoking.
French: Vous devez cesser de fumer.

English: Tom goes jogging almost every afternoon.
French: Tom va courir presque tous les après-midis.

English: Don't go in my room.
French: N'allez pas dans ma chambre !

English: I wish I had a million dollars.
French: J'aimerais disposer d'un million de dollars.

English: One of the dogs started barking.
French: L'un des chiens se mit à aboyer.

English: His father left him the house in his will.
French: Son père lui légua la maison dans son testament.

English: I have a lot of old books. A couple of them are quite valuable.
French: J'ai de nombreux vieux livres. Quelques-uns d'entre eux sont d'assez grande valeur.

English: Which wine goes best with red meat?
French: Quel vin accompagne au mieux la viande rouge ?

English: I really love my work.
French: J'adore vraiment mon travail.

English: I'm ugly.
French: Je suis laide.

English: Please speak more slowly.
French: S'il te plaît, parle moins vite.

English: Tom knows what you did.
French: Tom sait ce que vous avez fait.

English: Prices have jumped.
French: Les prix ont bondi.

English: Please change the punctuation.
French: Veuillez changer la ponctuation.

English: Don't ask any questions.
French: Ne posez aucune question.

English: I'm all yours.
French: Je suis tout à vous.

English: Where's the checkout counter?
French: Où est la caisse ?

English: Ethnic minorities struggle against prejudice, poverty, and oppression.
French: Les minorités ethniques luttent contre les préjugés, la pauvreté et l'oppression.

English: Playing go is my favorite pastime.
French: Mon passe-temps favori est le jeu de go.

English: She is always complaining of her job.
French: Elle se plaint toujours de son travail.

English: Bring me my hat.
French: Apporte-moi mon chapeau.

English: Could you change these for me, please?
French: Pouvez-vous changer cela pour moi s'il vous plait ?

English: Keep on smiling.
French: Restez souriante.

English: I'm tired of pretending.
French: J'en ai assez de faire semblant.

English: As you climb higher, the air becomes colder.
French: En montant plus haut, l'air devient plus froid.

English: You do that and I'll fire you.
French: Tu fais ça et je te vire.

English: Everyone changes.
French: Tout le monde change.

English: Will it rain today?
French: Pleuvra-t-il aujourd'hui ?

English: I didn't know you had a cat.
French: J'ignorais que vous aviez un chat.

English: I thought you'd be dead by now.
French: Je pensais que tu serais morte, à l'heure qu'il est.

English: Did you have a good summer?
French: As-tu passé un bel été ?

English: I didn't go to school yesterday.
French: Je n'ai pas été à l'école hier.

English: My English teacher recommended that I read these books.
French: Mon professeur d'anglais a recommandé que je lise ces livres.

English: I deserved that.
French: Je méritais ça.

English: He silently went out of the room.
French: Il quitta la pièce en silence.

English: Was he lying on his back?
French: Était-il allongé sur le dos ?

English: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
French: Les fous se précipitent là où les anges craignent de mettre les pieds.

English: She was buried in her hometown.
French: On l'a enterrée dans sa ville natale.

English: You're the only person I know who is qualified for this job.
French: Vous êtes la seule personne que je connaisse qui soit qualifiée pour ce poste.

English: You were scared, weren't you?
French: Tu as eu peur, n'est-ce pas ?

English: We want a rematch.
French: Nous voulons une revanche.

English: What've you got?
French: Qu'as-tu ?

English: I have no children.
French: Je n'ai pas d'enfants.

English: I can't even remember my own name.
French: Je ne peux même pas me souvenir de mon propre nom.

English: We're waiting for you to leave.
French: Nous attendons que tu sois parti.

English: Don't make me use this gun.
French: Ne m'oblige pas à utiliser ce pistolet.

English: How old is your brother?
French: Quel âge a ton frère ?

English: Please don't forget to put a stamp on the letter before mailing it.
French: S'il te plait n'oublie pas de mettre un timbre sur la lettre avant de l'envoyer.

English: I still like Tom.
French: J'aime toujours Tom.

English: Tom is perfect for you.
French: Tom est parfait pour vous.

English: I can't tell you how much this means to me.
French: Je ne peux pas te dire combien ça signifie pour moi.

English: I had a busy morning.
French: J'ai eu une matinée chargée.

English: It is two miles from here to the park.
French: Le parc est à deux miles (~3.2km) d'ici.

English: That's super easy.
French: C'est super facile.

English: I don't expect to be gone long.
French: Je ne m'attends pas à être partie pour longtemps.

English: I have an old car.
French: J'ai une vieille voiture.

English: I can't hide out forever.
French: Je ne peux pas éternellement me cacher.

English: The woman gave birth to a baby girl.
French: La femme mit au monde une petite fille.

English: I hate when other people make me wait a long time.
French: Je déteste que les autres gens me fassent attendre pendant longtemps.

English: I don't want you to worry about me.
French: Je ne veux pas que vous vous fassiez du souci à mon sujet.

English: I want to work.
French: Je veux travailler.

English: How much does your daughter weigh?
French: Combien pèse votre fille ?

English: You'll be able to take many pictures with your new camera.
French: Tu pourras prendre beaucoup de photos avec ton nouvel appareil.

English: Don't let this information leak out.
French: Ne laissez pas cette information fuiter.

English: I bought a hat.
French: J'ai fait l'acquisition d'un chapeau.

English: Could I get my ring back?
French: Pourrais-je récupérer ma bague ?

English: Don't let me down like you did the other day.
French: Ne me laisse pas tomber comme tu l'as fait l'autre jour.

English: I thought you'd gone and left me.
French: Je pensais que vous seriez partis et m'auriez quittée.

English: His mother used to be a singer.
French: Sa mère était chanteuse.

English: Why are they here?
French: Pourquoi sont-elles ici ?

English: That's not funny.
French: Ce n'est pas drôle !

English: I am staying for another few weeks.
French: Je reste pour quelques autres semaines.

English: Nature plays an important role in our life.
French: La nature joue un rôle important dans notre vie.

English: Let me see your health insurance certificate.
French: Faites-moi voir votre carte d'assurance sociale.

English: Can we close the door?
French: Pouvons-nous fermer la porte ?

English: We are making progress.
French: Nous faisons des progrès.

English: I will hit the sack.
French: Je vais me piauter.

English: Did you tell Tom why you're here?
French: As-tu dit à Tom pourquoi tu es ici ?

English: That's just what I'm going to do.
French: C'est justement ce que je vais faire.

English: I've warned you before about this.
French: Je vous ai prévenu auparavant.

English: They're not home yet.
French: Ils ne sont pas encore à la maison.

English: I love to eat cakes.
French: J'aime manger des gâteaux.

English: I met them.
French: Je les rencontrai.

English: I have a friend whose father is a famous pianist.
French: J'ai un ami dont le père est un pianiste connu.

English: We will have an English test this afternoon.
French: Nous aurons un test d'Anglais cette après-midi.

English: How fast does this car go?
French: À quelle vitesse va cette voiture ?

English: I won't let you go there.
French: Je ne vous laisserez pas y aller.

English: The doctor ordered a full physical examination for the patient.
French: Le médecin ordonna un examen complet du patient.

English: The suspect wanted to avoid being arrested.
French: Le suspect voulait éviter d'être arrêté.

English: I bet you're wondering how this works.
French: Je parie que vous vous demandez comment ça marche.

English: You'll never be alone.
French: Vous ne serez jamais seul.

English: I saw you with Tom.
French: Je t'ai vue avec Tom.

English: We'll be there.
French: Nous y serons.

English: Tom is three years older than you.
French: Tom a trois ans de plus que toi.

English: I'm going to fix some dinner.
French: Je vais préparer à dîner.

English: Where are your people?
French: Où sont vos proches ?

English: Do you want some help?
French: Veux-tu de l'aide ?

English: Did anybody notice this?
French: Quiconque l'a-t-il remarqué ?

English: I'll see to it first thing tomorrow.
French: J'y veillerai demain à la première heure.

English: Tom is extremely patient.
French: Tom est extrêmement patient.

English: Are you that stupid?
French: Es-tu aussi bête ?

English: I am doing my homework.
French: Je suis en train de faire mes devoirs.

English: She was promoted.
French: Elle fut promue.

English: He picked up a stone.
French: Il ramassa une pierre.

English: About how much will I have to pay for all the treatments?
French: À peu près combien devrai-je payer pour tous les traitements ?

English: We're not your enemy.
French: Nous ne sommes pas vos ennemies.

English: I hadn't planned to tell you.
French: Je n'avais pas prévu de vous le raconter.

English: She played the violin.
French: Elle a joué du violon.

English: You're lazy.
French: Vous êtes paresseux.

English: I can teach you how to pray.
French: Je peux t'enseigner à prier.

English: I really don't want to go to Boston with Tom.
French: Je ne veux vraiment pas aller à Boston avec Tom.

English: He asked me what I expected.
French: Il m'a demandé ce que j'espérais.

English: Somebody poisoned Tom.
French: Quelqu'un a empoisonné Tom.

English: I'm glad you didn't do it.
French: Je suis heureux que vous le n'ayez pas fait.

English: I know the exact time when that happened.
French: Je sais exactement le moment auquel c'est arrivé.

English: I think I look fat in these jeans.
French: Je pense avoir l'air grosse, dans ce jean.

English: What will happen to her?
French: Qu'adviendra-t-il d'elle ?

English: The fuse has blown.
French: Le fusible a fondu.

English: He has a headache.
French: Il a un mal de tête.

English: He has a lot of acquaintances.
French: Il a beaucoup de connaissances.

English: I'm going.
French: Je pars.

English: I asked him to do that.
French: Je lui ai demandé de faire ça.

English: This will only take a second.
French: Ça ne prendra qu'une seconde.

English: I'm so proud of you.
French: Je suis tellement fier de toi.

English: You don't give up too easily, do you?
French: Vous n'abandonnez pas tellement facilement, n'est-ce pas ?

English: If anything happens here, can I depend on you?
French: Si quoi que ce soit se produit ici, puis-je compter sur toi ?

English: I thought Tom would be at the bar.
French: Je pensais que Tom serait au bar.

English: Where did he do it?
French: Où l'a-t-il fait ?

English: I have a lot of love for you.
French: J'ai beaucoup d'amour pour vous.

English: Tom walked to the front of the room.
French: Tom se dirigea vers l'avant de la salle.

English: I love you just as you are.
French: Je t'aime juste comme tu es.

English: That can happen.
French: Ça peut arriver.

English: She wasn't able to meet him.
French: Elle a été dans l'incapacité de le rencontrer.

English: You have gone too far.
French: Vous êtes allée trop loin.

English: The rain didn't stop them from doing their job.
French: La pluie ne les a pas empêchés de faire leur travail.

English: It matters little whether he comes late or not.
French: Cela importe peu qu'il vienne tard ou non.

English: They're thirty dollars each.
French: Ils sont à trente dollars chacun.

English: She asked him to not quit his job.
French: Elle l'a prié de ne pas quitter son emploi.

English: The old man tripped over his own feet.
French: Le vieil homme a trébuché.

English: She urged him to study harder.
French: Elle l'enjoignit de travailler plus fort.

English: I let you catch me.
French: Je vous ai laissé m'attraper.

English: I wish you could come with us.
French: J'aimerais que vous puissiez venir avec nous.

English: The more I get, the more I want.
French: Plus j'en obtiens, plus j'en veux.

English: He accepted my present.
French: Il a accepté mon cadeau.

English: Get out of my room!
French: Sors de ma chambre !

English: I had a tooth pulled.
French: On m'a arraché une dent.

English: It wasn't much of a party.
French: C'était plutôt réduit, comme fête.

English: I burned them.
French: Je l'ai brûlé.

English: I never wanted to hurt anyone.
French: Je n'ai jamais voulu faire de mal à quiconque.

English: At the station, I had the hardest time finding my ticket.
French: À la gare, j'ai eu le plus grand mal à trouver mon billet.

English: I have already had my breakfast.
French: J'ai déjà mangé mon petit déjeuner.

English: We were talking to each other all the time.
French: Nous étions tout le temps en train de parler entre nous.

English: I can't explain the difference between those two.
French: Je ne peux expliquer la différence entre les deux.

English: You may stay here as long as you keep quiet.
French: Tu peux rester ici, du moment que tu gardes le silence.

English: I don't think anyone noticed what we did.

French: Les règles sont faites pour être préservées, non pas violées.

French: Brosse-toi les dents au moins deux fois par jour.

French: Je lui ai demandé de relever les chiffres du compteur.

French: Je dois rencontrer Tom pour déjeuner dans un restaurant sur la rue Park.

English: That's what makes me nervous.

French: C'est au cours de la période glaciaire que le tigre à dents de sabre s'est éteint.

English: Raise your hand before you answer.

French: Il donnait d'ordinaire à manger à son chien, de la nourriture pour chien bon marché.

English: I had to stop.

French: La petite fille, profondément émue par la triste histoire du vieil homme, fondit en larmes.

French: Je peux mettre des choses dans une boîte.

English: I live just up the road.

English: He had his son die last year.
French: Son fils est mort l'année dernière.

French: Le juge prononça une peine de cinq ans de travaux forcés.

French: Il a une voiture que je lui ai donnée.

English: There is plenty of water.

English: Tom didn't want to sing.

English: Just close your eyes.

English: I need that as soon as possible.

French: Il y a eu quelques questions inattendues.

French: Avez-vous grandi à Boston ?

English: He fell asleep immediately.
French: Il s'est endormi immédiatement.

English: In all likelihood, the president will serve a second term.
French: En toute probabilité, le président exercera un second mandat.

English: I don't like your name.
French: Je n'aime pas ton prénom.

English: I'm glad you could make it.
French: Je suis ravi que vous ayez pu le faire.

English: As a result, prices rose.
French: Conséquemment, les prix ont augmenté.

English: I remember them.
French: Je me souviens d'eux.

English: I feel like such an idiot.
French: Je me sens tellement idiote.

English: Despite all his setbacks, he remains an optimist.
French: Malgré tous ses revers, il reste optimiste.

English: I am a teacher, too.
French: Moi aussi, je suis professeur.

English: I am older than him.
French: Je suis plus vieux que lui.

English: Why are you lying?

English: I was impressed with what I saw.
French: J'ai été impressionné par ce que j'ai vu.

English: It was night.
French: Il faisait nuit.

English: You can't rely on his help.
French: Vous ne pouvez pas compter sur son aide.

English: Don't touch my car.
French: Touche pas à ma bagnole !

English: Tom painted the fence.
French: Tom a peint la clôture.

English: You seemed to like that.
French: Vous avez eu l'air de l'apprécier.

English: His neighbor will care for the children while she is away.
French: Son voisin s'occupera des enfants pendant son absence.

English: I'm so drunk that I can't feel my face anymore.
French: Je suis tellement bourré que je ne peux plus sentir mon visage.

English: This is the only alternative.
French: C'est la seule possibilité.

English: I no longer need a loan.
French: Je n'ai plus besoin d'un prêt.

English: Her car might be more pleasant to drive, but it also costs her more for maintenance.
French: Sa voiture est peut-être plus agréable à conduire, mais elle lui coûte aussi plus cher en frais d'entretien.

English: Actually, I'm not quite sure.
French: En vérité, je n'en suis pas tout à fait sûre.

English: Please don't forget to put stamps on the letters that I gave you to mail.
French: Veuillez ne pas oublier de timbrer les lettres que je vous ai données à poster.

English: We're heading for disaster.
French: Nous allons au devant d'un désastre.

English: People don't say that anymore.
French: On ne dit plus ça.

English: You were hurt, weren't you?
French: Vous avez été blessé, n'est-ce pas ?

English: They have solved the problem once and for all.
French: Elles ont résolu le problème une fois pour toutes.

English: We're being watched.
French: On nous regarde.

English: Don't let the dog sleep in our bed.
French: Ne laissez pas le chien dormir dans notre lit !

English: Why do you really want to lose weight?
French: Pourquoi voulez-vous perdre du poids, en réalité ?

English: I like her very much.
French: Je l'aime beaucoup.

English: How much am I paying you?
French: Combien est-ce que je vous paie ?

English: English is a Germanic language.
French: L'anglais est une langue germanique.

English: That's very considerate of you.
French: C'est fort prévenant de ta part.

English: Don't be so outraged.
French: Ne sois pas si indignée !

English: Tell Tom that everyone is here.
French: Dites à Tom que tout le monde est ici.

English: Your cat will survive.
French: Votre chatte survivra.

English: Is there something in the fridge we can drink?
French: Y a-t-il au frigo quelque chose qu'on puisse boire ?

English: My little brother always sleeps with his teddy bear.
French: Mon petit frère dort toujours avec son ours en peluche.

English: Plastic boxes last longer.
French: Les boîtes en plastique durent plus longtemps.

English: You are a troublemaker.
French: Vous êtes un fauteur de trouble.

English: I read five different magazines each month.
French: Je lis cinq différents types de magazine chaque mois.

English: He kept waiting for hours and hours.
French: Il continua à attendre pendant des heures et des heures.

English: I stuck my hands in my pockets.
French: J'ai mis les mains dans mes poches.

English: I wish I had eaten lunch before I came here.
French: J'aurais aimé avoir déjeuné avant de venir ici.

English: They got into the train.
French: Elles sont montées dans le train.

English: What insects have you eaten?
French: Quels insectes as-tu mangé ?

English: What are some foods you usually eat with your fingers?
French: Quels sont les aliments que tu manges habituellement avec les doigts ?

English: It took more than a month to get over my cold, but I'm OK now.
French: Cela m'a pris plus d'un mois pour me débarrasser de mon rhume, mais je vais bien maintenant.

English: I'll show you the way out.
French: Je vais vous montrer la sortie.

English: He begged for his life.
French: Il supplia qu'on épargne sa vie.

English: It tastes like chicken.
French: Ça a le même goût que le poulet.

English: Please sit still.
French: S'il vous plaît, tenez-vous tranquilles.

English: I'm so tired that I can't walk any longer.

English: I must postpone going to the dentist.
French: Je dois décaler mon rendez-vous chez le dentiste.

English: I have better things to do.
French: J'ai de meilleures choses à faire.

English: Don't sneak up on me like that.
French: Ne me prends pas par surprise comme ça.

English: He could read me like an open book.
French: Il savait lire en moi comme à livre ouvert.

English: He has a hat on.
French: Il porte un chapeau.

English: They can't do this.
French: Ils ne peuvent faire cela.

English: When did you become a teacher?
French: Quand êtes-vous devenue enseignante ?

English: The bridge is being repainted.
French: Le pont est en train d'être repeint.

English: Once he had written the letter, he sent it.
French: La lettre une fois écrite, il l'expédia.

English: I know you don't want to talk about what happened.
French: Je sais que vous ne voulez pas parler de ce qui s'est produit.

English: Open your book to page ten.
French: Ouvrez votre livre en page dix.

English: He tried several times, but failed.
French: Il essaya plusieurs fois mais ne réussit pas.

English: I usually don't bother with people like him.
French: Je ne me soucie pas, d'ordinaire, de gens comme lui.

English: I don't know a thing about her.
French: Je ne sais rien d'elle.

English: Tickets are available to the public for $30.
French: Les billets sont disponibles au public pour 30 $.

English: I'm sure my parents won't let me go by myself.
French: Je suis certain que mes parents ne me laisseront pas aller seul.

English: It may have rained a little last night.
French: Il se peut qu'il ait plu un peu hier soir.

English: The children went out to play.
French: Les enfants sont sortis pour jouer.

English: I wasn't aware that someone was watching me.
French: Je n'avais pas conscience que quelqu'un m'observait.

English: It is out of the question.
French: C'est hors de question.

English: I'm crazy.
French: Je suis fou.

English: I need to know who I have to give this to.
French: J'ai besoin de savoir à qui je dois donner ceci.

English: What more do you need?
French: De quoi as-tu besoin de plus ?

English: You must know Tom pretty well.
French: Tu dois connaître Tom assez bien.

English: I was completely shocked.
French: J'étais totalement sous le choc.

English: I pretended to work.
French: J'ai feint de travailler.

English: Which brand do you prefer?
French: Quelle marque préfères-tu ?

English: Tom's doctor told him to quit smoking.
French: Le médecin de Tom lui a dit d'arrêter de fumer.

English: I quite agree with you.
French: Je suis assez d'accord avec vous.

English: I thought you went home.
French: Je pensais que vous étiez allé chez vous.

English: Get in the car and lock the doors.
French: Monte dans la voiture et verrouille les portes !

English: We don't have all afternoon.
French: Nous n'avons pas tout l'après-midi.

English: I'm in way over my head.
French: Cela me dépasse complètement.

English: You can't back out.
French: Vous ne pouvez pas vous dédire.

English: We're on our own.
French: Nous sommes seuls.

English: I just found an old diary.
French: Je viens de trouver un vieux journal.

English: We hope to do better this week.
French: Nous espérons faire mieux cette semaine.

English: I'm not saying this to hurt you, but it's the truth.
French: Je ne le dis pas pour vous blesser mais c'est la vérité.

English: Tom should've gone to Boston with Mary.
French: Tom aurait dû aller à Boston avec Mary.

English: I thought that she was pregnant.
French: Je croyais que elle était enceinte.

English: Could I have some more coffee?
French: Pourrais-je avoir un peu plus de café ?

English: Thanks for coming.
French: Merci d'être venues.

English: I'm not going to tell you how to do that.
French: Je ne vais pas te dire comment le faire.

English: We probably don't want to do that again.
French: Nous ne voulons probablement recommencer cela.

English: We're finished here.
French: Nous en avons fini, ici.

English: I'm not giving you any more money.
French: Je ne vous donnerai pas davantage d'argent.

English: We're ambitious.
French: Nous sommes ambitieux.

English: Keep your eye on the ball.
French: Ne quitte pas la balle des yeux.

English: I'm not old.
French: Je ne suis pas vieux.

English: Do your parents know about this?
French: Vos parents savent-ils cela ?

English: There are fifty stars on the American flag.
French: Il y a cinquante étoiles sur le drapeau américain.

English: You can't change your mind now.
French: Tu ne peux pas changer d'avis maintenant.

English: Why did you do this to me?
French: Pourquoi m'as-tu fait ça ?

English: That's what I need to know.
French: C'est ce qu'il me faut savoir.

English: She was a bit late.
French: Elle était un peu en retard.

English: He does it faster than you.
French: Il le fait plus rapidement que toi.

English: Can we just go home?
French: Pouvons-nous juste rentrer chez nous ?

English: Unfortunately, it rained yesterday.
French: Malheureusement, il pleuvait hier.

English: I care about all of you.
French: Je me soucie de vous tous.

English: I don't care for foreign food.
French: Je ne m'intéresse pas à la nourriture étrangère.

English: He and I are teachers.
French: Lui et moi sommes instituteurs.

English: Doesn't that mean anything to you?
French: Cela ne signifie-t-il rien pour toi ?

English: Tom ran at full speed.
French: Tom courut à pleine vitesse.

English: It's far too small.
French: C'est beaucoup trop petit.

English: I don't need a ride.
French: Je n'ai pas besoin qu'on me conduise.

English: Where's the restroom?
French: Où sont les toilettes ?

English: Let me check it.
French: Laisse-moi voir ça.

English: After we walked for a while, we got to the lake.
French: Après avoir marché un moment, nous sommes parvenus au lac.

English: Hi! I'm new here.
French: Salut ! Je suis nouveau, ici.

English: Why did you turn away when you met him?
French: Pourquoi t'es-tu détourné lorsque tu l'as rencontré ?

English: We were told by him to leave the room at once.
French: Il nous a dit de quitter immédiatement la pièce.

English: The burglar was traced by one of the things he had left on the scene.
French: Le cambrioleur fut détecté par l'une des choses qu'il avait laissée sur place.

English: Back off.
French: Reculez.

English: They clung together for warmth.
French: Ils se cramponnèrent l'un l'autre pour garder leur chaleur.

English: That sounds very tempting.
French: Ça semble très tentant.

English: I have a client waiting in the waiting room.
French: J'ai un client qui attend dans la salle d'attente.

English: All the students protested against the war.
French: Tous les étudiants ont protesté contre la guerre.

English: Tell me where you've been.
French: Dis-moi où tu étais.

English: He ran up the stairs.
French: Il courut au haut des escaliers.

English: This car is fast.
French: Cette voiture est rapide.

English: We both want it.
French: Nous le voulons toutes les deux.

English: That isn't enough.
French: Ce n'est pas suffisant.

English: I'm done with you.
French: Moi j'en ai fini avec toi.

English: Tom wanted to cry.
French: Tom voulait pleurer.

English: You know very well what Tom wants.
French: Tu sais très bien ce que Tom désire.

English: It is on this point that our opinions differ.
French: C'est sur ce point que nos opinions diffèrent.

English: I hope you two are happy.
French: J'espère que vous êtes heureuses toutes les deux.

English: How tall you are!
French: Que vous êtes grande !

English: Can you read that sign ahead of us?
French: Arrivez-vous à lire cette indication au-dessus de nous ?

English: He feels hurt.
French: Il se sent blessé.

English: It's his problem, not mine.
French: C'est son problème, pas le mien.

English: Did I break it?
French: L'ai-je brisée ?

English: There's no coffee.
French: Il n'y a pas de café.

English: Did you have fun last night?
French: Vous êtes-vous amusé hier soir ?

English: Come on, don't be a coward!
French: Viens, ne sois pas un lâche !

English: I've been feeling bad for a week.
French: Je me suis senti mal pendant une semaine.

English: You should look this word up.
French: Vous devriez rechercher ce mot.

English: I want to stay here longer.
French: Je veux rester ici plus longtemps.

English: John is two years older than I am.
French: John a deux ans de plus que moi.

English: I'd better get to bed soon.
French: Je ferais mieux d'aller tôt au lit.

English: I am not interested in material gain.
French: Je ne suis pas intéressé par le gain matériel.

English: Cold this morning, isn't it?
French: Il fait froid ce matin, n'est-ce pas ?

English: I couldn't breathe.
French: Je ne pouvais pas respirer.

English: I wasn't sure I could do it.
French: Je n'étais pas sûr de pouvoir le faire.

English: I'm worried about the future.
French: Je m’inquiète pour l'avenir.

English: A fire broke out in my neighborhood last night.
French: Un feu s'est déclenché dans mon quartier la nuit dernière.

English: Where do you think we came from?
French: D'où pensez-vous que nous sommes venus ?

English: I love your son.
French: Je suis amoureuse de ton fils.

English: Anything that can be misunderstood will be.
French: Tout ce qui peut être mal compris le sera.

English: They made the right choice.
French: Ils ont fait le bon choix.

English: He speaks English a little.
French: Il parle un peu anglais.

English: I can't do it alone. You have to help me.
French: Je ne peux le faire seule. Il vous faut m'aider.

English: The price of oil is down this week.
French: Le prix du pétrole est en baisse cette semaine.

English: He is away from home.
French: Il est loin de chez lui.

English: There are five patients in the waiting room.
French: Il y a cinq patients dans la salle d'attente.

English: I waited for him till ten.
French: Je l'ai attendu jusqu'à dix heures.

English: No one else could do my work.
French: Personne d'autre ne pourrait faire mon travail.

English: You don't sound entirely convinced.
French: À vous entendre, vous n'êtes pas complètement convaincues.

English: He enjoys his position.
French: Il apprécie sa situation.

English: The kids are making too much noise.
French: Les enfants font trop de bruit.

English: How did the railway accident at Tokyo Station happen?
French: Comment l'accident de chemin de fer à la gare de Tokyo est-il arrivé ?

English: I cannot speak German.
French: Je ne sais pas parler allemand.

English: My father is oblivious to the emotional pain his abuse caused me.
French: Mon père ne se rend pas compte de la douleur émotionnelle que ses injures m'ont causée.

English: The prince asked the little girl why she was crying.
French: Le prince a demandé à la petite fille pourquoi elle pleurait.

English: He keeps a diary in English.
French: Il tient un journal en anglais.

English: I like old cars.
French: J'aime les vieilles voitures.

English: The medicine didn't do me any good.
French: Ce médicament ne m'a été d'aucun secours.

English: Don't make me do it again.
French: Ne me faites pas le refaire !

English: This book is geared towards beginners.
French: Ce livre s'adresse aux débutants.

English: I'm very happy now.
French: Je suis très heureux maintenant.

English: Right now they're all sleeping.
French: En ce moment, elles dorment toutes.

English: He suggested a plan similar to mine.
French: Il a suggéré un plan similaire au mien.

English: I'm going to tell Tom that.
French: Je vais dire ça à Tom.

English: Where's everybody?
French: Où est tout le monde ?

English: I do not doubt that he is sincere.
French: Je n'ai aucun doute concernant sa sincérité.

English: Let me know when you will arrive at the airport.
French: Dites-moi quand vous arrivez à l'aéroport.

English: You're wasting my time.
French: Vous gaspillez mon temps.

English: I sincerely hope that you will soon recover from your illness.
French: J'espère sincèrement que tu te remettras bientôt de ta maladie.

English: Who's going?

English: It's probably just my imagination.
French: Ce n'est probablement que mon imagination.

English: They made their way through the crowd.
French: Ils se sont frayé un chemin à travers la foule.

English: She worked hard.
French: Elle travaillait dur.

English: Why are there so many dishonest people in the world?
French: Pourquoi y a-t'il tant de gens malhonnêtes dans le monde ?

English: He is not altogether wrong.
French: Il n'a pas entièrement tort.

English: I'm leaving you tomorrow.
French: Je te quitte demain.

English: He is a good student.
French: C'est un bon étudiant.

English: He has just graduated from college.
French: Il est fraîchement diplômé de l'université.

English: He's going to sit here.
French: Il va s'asseoir ici.

English: I'm aware of that.
French: J'en suis consciente.

English: Tom really is a nice person, isn't he?
French: Tom est vraiment une personne sympathique, n'est-ce pas ?

English: Organic food tastes better.
French: La nourriture bio a meilleur goût.

English: I knew you could do it.
French: Je savais que tu pouvais le faire.

English: Do you want your old job back?
French: Veux-tu récupérer ton ancien poste ?

English: I want to spend my life with you.
French: Je veux passer ma vie avec vous.

English: My bag was stolen.
French: On m'a volé mon sac.

English: I sent him a letter to let him know my decision.
French: Je lui ai envoyé une lettre pour lui faire savoir ma décision.

English: I'm not that desperate yet.
French: Je ne suis pas encore si désespéré.

English: If you want to succeed, use your time well.
French: Si vous voulez réussir, gérez bien votre temps.

English: All I want is your love.
French: Tout ce que je veux, c'est votre affection.

English: Place the ladder against the wall.
French: Mettez l'échelle contre le mur.

English: Tom doesn't like to lend his books to Mary.
French: Tom n'aime pas prêter ses livres à Mary.

English: What a lucky person he is!
French: Quel homme chanceux il est.

English: She said that she was happy.
French: Elle dit qu'elle était heureuse.

English: Have you gotten used to eating Japanese food yet?
French: Vous êtes-vous enfin accoutumés à consommer de la nourriture japonaise ?

English: This sure tastes good!
French: Ça a vraiment bon goût !

English: Please write to me from time to time.
French: Écris-moi de temps en temps, s'il te plait.

English: Will you have another slice of pie?
French: Veux-tu une autre part de tarte ?

English: That was a problem.
French: C'était un problème.

English: That can't be true.
French: Ça ne peut être vrai.

English: Our house faces the beach.
French: Notre maison est en face de la plage.

English: She is not afraid to die.
French: Elle n'a pas peur de mourir.

English: We have plenty of work to do this morning.
French: Nous avons beaucoup à faire ce matin.

English: The Kiso River is often called the Rhine of Japan.
French: La rivière Kiso est souvent appelée le Rhin du Japon.

English: Tom kicked down the door and entered Mary's room.
French: Tom fracassa la porte et pénétra dans la chambre de Mary.

English: I'll stay here until ten.
French: Je resterai ici jusqu'à dix heures.

English: I'll be happy to work with you.
French: Je serai heureux de travailler avec vous.

English: We're still a team.
French: Nous sommes encore une équipe.

English: Play us a tune.
French: Joue-nous un morceau.

English: I'm glad you decided to come.
French: Je me réjouis que vous vous soyez décidé à venir.

English: Tom is very afraid of snakes.
French: Tom a très peur des serpents.

English: I can't explain why it happened.
French: Je ne peux pas expliquer pourquoi cela est arrivé.

English: Take a chance.
French: Essayez !

English: It's good enough.
French: C'est suffisamment bon.

English: It may be that he will never be famous.
French: Peut-être ne sera-t-il jamais célèbre.

English: My mother always gets up earlier in the morning.
French: Ma mère se lève toujours plus tôt le matin.

English: They used a high-speed camera.
French: Ils ont utilisé un appareil photo à haute vitesse.

English: I had my radio repaired by him.
French: Je lui ai fait réparer la radio.

English: She spends a lot of money when she goes abroad.
French: Elle dépense beaucoup d'argent quand elle va à l'étranger.

English: The man who I thought was my friend deceived me.
French: L'homme que je pensais être mon ami m'a trompé.

English: We never forget.
French: Nous n'oublions jamais.

English: I'm right beside you.
French: Je suis juste à ton côté.

English: The two sides hold talks this week.
French: Les deux parties ont des pourparlers cette semaine.

English: He looked around.
French: Il a regardé aux alentours.

English: I can't hear anything at all.
French: Je n'arrive pas à entendre quoi que ce soit.

English: Did I hear you right?
French: Vous ai-je bien entendues ?

English: Do you think your parents spent enough time with you when you were in your teens?
French: Pensez-vous que vos parents ont passé suffisamment de temps avec vous lorsque vous étiez adolescentes ?

English: I know someone who can help you.
French: Je connais quelqu'un qui peut vous aider.

English: How does this disease spread?
French: Comment la maladie se diffuse-t-elle ?

English: There's someone waiting for me outside.
French: Il y a quelqu'un qui m'attend dehors.

English: Now go have fun.
French: Maintenant, allez vous amuser.

English: I had the same problem when I was your age.
French: J'ai eu le même problème à votre âge.

English: When will the new magazine come out?
French: Quand le nouveau magazine paraîtra-t-il ?

English: You can stay in the extra bedroom if you want.
French: Vous pouvez rester dans la chambre supplémentaire, si vous voulez.

English: I'll go tell the others what we need to do.
French: Je vais dire aux autres ce que nous devons faire.

English: His old cat is still alive.
French: Son vieux chat est encore en vie.

English: How many books do you read per month?
French: Combien de livres lis-tu par mois ?

English: It is always difficult for a son to live up to the expectations of his parents.
French: Il est toujours difficile à un fils de satisfaire les espoirs de ses parents.

English: I wanted to buy you something nice.
French: Je voulais t'acheter quelque chose de chouette.

English: I'm in love with you.
French: Je suis amoureux de vous.

English: Are scientists close to cloning a human being? "Not by a long shot."
French: «Les scientifiques sont-ils sur le point de répliquer un être humain ?» «Loin s'en faut.»

English: That's how the pros do it.
French: C'est comme ça que le font les pros.

English: A swarm of hornets attacked the children.
French: Un essaim de frelons s'en prit aux enfants.

English: It is too long ago.
French: C'est il y a trop longtemps.

English: Isn't she a doctor?
French: N'est-elle pas médecin ?

English: Be a good girl.
French: Soyez une chic fille !

English: You must return the book to him.
French: C'est à lui que tu dois rendre ce livre.

English: The outcome of the upcoming election will be the hardest ever to predict.
French: L'issue de l'élection à venir sera la plus difficile à prédire.

English: I have no time tomorrow.
French: Je n'ai pas le temps demain.

English: She was kind enough to help me.
French: Elle a été assez gentille pour m'aider.

English: Tom has lots of friends in Boston.
French: Tom a beaucoup d'amis à Boston.

English: I've spent a lot of time in casinos.
French: J'ai passé beaucoup de temps dans des casinos.

English: I don't want to discuss it.
French: Je ne veux pas en discuter.

English: I want to hear you scream.
French: Je veux t'entendre hurler.

English: It is ten minutes before eleven.
French: Il est onze heures moins dix.

English: I don't even want to know.
French: Je ne veux même pas savoir.

English: You're lazy.
French: Tu es paresseux.

English: They announced that they were getting a divorce.
French: Ils ont annoncé qu'ils allaient divorcer.

English: I can't save you this time.
French: Je ne peux te sauver, cette fois.

English: I don't think there's any harm in telling you now.
French: Je ne pense pas qu'il y ait de mal à vous le dire maintenant.

English: The pain she suffered while being tortured was unimaginable.
French: La douleur qu'elle endura en étant torturée fut inimaginable.

French: Tom n'a même pas eu assez d'argent pour un café.

French: Tom a fait appel à un expert.

French: La radio nous a averti de la survenue d'un tremblement de terre et nous avons commencé à rassembler nos affaires.

English: We're survivors.

English: If there's anything at all that you don't understand, you can ask me anytime.

English: What did it look like?

English: Do you have time the day after tomorrow?

English: Schools and roads are services paid for by taxes.
French: Les écoles et les routes sont des services payés par les impôts.

English: Cars arrived there one after another.
French: Les voitures arrivèrent l'une après l'autre.

English: Forty people attended.
French: Quarante personnes étaient présentes.

English: I got what I asked for.
French: J'ai obtenu ce que j'ai demandé.

English: Are you studying?

English: I have a friend whose wife is a pianist.

English: Let's see how the negotiations pan out before we decide.

English: You don't look like your dad.

English: If you go out so lightly dressed, you'll catch a cold.

English: Do you want me to paint your fingernails?

English: Are all of these people your friends?

English: There is nothing to cancel.

English: He peddled his "miracle cure" to desperate cancer patients.
French: Il fourguait son "traitement miracle" aux malades du cancer désespérés.

English: Who was this picture painted by?

English: I just wish we could leave this horrible place.

English: I remember when it happened.

English: School begins on April the tenth.

English: I saw something strange in the sky.

English: I've got a meeting at 2:30.

English: It's going really well.

English: Some healthcare workers spend more time doing paperwork than taking care of patients.
French: Certains employés de santé passent davantage de temps à faire de la paperasse qu'à prendre soin de patients.

English: Tom looks older than he really is.
French: Tom semble plus âgé qu'il ne l'ait réellement.

English: I can't help.

English: Do you still love him?

English: It was really funny.

English: Get out of bed.

English: It's easily done.

English: Why didn't you believe me?

English: They called it mass murder.

English: Tom is very late, isn't he?

English: I don't like your friends.

English: Everyone was asleep.

English: Tom has a lot of valuable books.
French: Tom a beaucoup de livres de valeur.

English: She warmed herself by the fire.

English: I think you might need my help.

English: Please let go of my arm.

English: I know it very well.

English: Some people believe they can become rich without having to work.
French: Certaines personnes croient qu'elles peuvent devenir riches sans avoir à travailler.

English: Write on every other line.

English: Forward this to everyone you know.

English: No one showed up.

English: Cows provide us with milk.

English: The dog bit my hand.

French: Le candidat au poste n'a pas satisfait aux attentes de l'employeur.

English: It took me more than two hours to translate a few pages of English.

English: I'd like to discuss this with your boss.

English: This fruit doesn't taste good.

English: How did you know I was going to say yes?

English: There's no right answer.

English: This doesn't feel right.

French: Il est prévu d'augmenter l'importation de bœuf américain pour satisfaire la demande croissante.

English: Don't worry. This won't happen again.

English: I think you like me.

English: I don't see that it matters now.

English: Your method is different from mine.

English: Last week she gave birth to a beautiful daughter.
French: La semaine dernière elle donna naissance à une jolie fille.

English: He wasn't there last week.

English: You're very stylish.

English: Tom could sell anything.

English: He has overcome many obstacles.

English: I'm sorry, I don't buy it.

English: She just left.

English: I think you might eventually change your mind.

English: I saw a dog swim across the river.
French: Je vis un chien traverser la rivière en nageant.

English: Tom does not like cheese.
French: Tom n’aime pas le fromage.

English: Which do you like better, this or that?
French: Lequel préfères-tu ? Celui-ci ou celui-là ?

English: I think you're going to survive.

English: I'm going to do an internship at a local company.
French: Je vais faire un stage dans une entreprise locale.

English: Tom disappeared into the crowd.
French: Tom disparut dans la foule.

English: My wife had a baby last week.
French: Ma femme a eu un bébé la semaine dernière.

English: She's completely crazy about him.

English: I understood what you meant.

English: I knocked on the door, but nobody answered.
French: Je frappai à la porte, mais personne ne répondit.

English: Tom has three cows.
French: Tom a trois vaches.

English: She gave him a big smile.
French: Elle lui envoya un grand sourire.

English: Don't forget that Tom still loves you.

English: I thought they wouldn't like you.

English: I will wait here until he comes back.
French: Je vais attendre ici qu'il revienne.

English: Tom hates waiting in line.

English: They're smiling at each other.

English: Between you and me, I think our boss is stupid.
French: De toi à moi, je pense que notre patron est stupide.

English: I moved to England from Germany when I was nine.
French: J'ai déménagé d'Allemagne en Angleterre lorsque j'avais neuf ans.

English: It has been confirmed.

English: The last train has already gone.

English: I can't eat meat.

French: Ce qui me fait penser que ça fait plus de trente ans depuis cet incident.

English: I'm sorry to disturb you, but there's a phone call for you.
French: Je suis désolé de te déranger, mais il y a un appel téléphonique pour toi.

English: Please sing.

English: Put it onto the table.

English: I want something to read.

English: Would you like to go with me?

French: Tom sirota du café.

English: Put that in writing.
French: Mettez ça par écrit.

English: As far as I know, he is an honest man.
French: Pour autant que je sache, c'est un homme honnête.

English: Sorry I didn't reply sooner.
French: Désolée de ne pas avoir répondu plus tôt.

English: Are you afraid?

English: There is an urgent need for more doctors.
French: Il y a un besoin urgent de davantage de médecins.

English: It's no problem.

English: How long did you stay at the party?
French: Combien de temps êtes-vous resté à la fête ?

English: This is an international community.

English: The door was partially open.
French: La porte était entrouverte.

English: Do you feel all right?

English: I'm going home now.
French: Je vais à la maison maintenant.

English: It is no good talking about it.

English: Do it again!

English: You're very talented.

English: Tom remembered that Mary and John had tried to kill him.
French: Tom s"est rappelé que Mary et John avaient essayé de le tuer.

English: Tom's prediction was accurate.
French: La prédiction de Tom était juste.

English: Don't change a thing.
French: Ne changez pas quoi que ce soit !

English: I don't know how much time we have.

English: Some people think eating at home is better for you than eating out.
French: Certains pensent que manger chez vous est meilleur pour vous que manger dehors.

French: Il y a de nombreuses personnes qui ne m'apprécient pas.

French: Qui ne gaspille pas ne manque de rien.

English: I blamed him for the accident.

French: J'ouvris une bouteille de vin rouge.

English: Tom thinks it's stupid.

English: I just felt a little dizzy. That's all.
French: Je me suis juste un peu sentie prise de vertiges. C'est tout.

French: Tom est-il un de vos amis ?

English: Let's see how Tom reacts to that.

English: I don't know much about your family.
French: Je ne sais pas grand-chose de ta famille.

English: Do I annoy you?

English: She is two years old, but she can already count to 100.
French: Elle n'a que deux ans, mais elle sait déjà compter jusqu'à 100.

English: How much money do you have in your pockets right now?
French: Combien d'argent as-tu dans tes poches à l'instant ?

English: Where can I reach you?

English: I felt safe.

English: Stop acting like a child.
French: Cesse de te conduire comme une enfant !

English: The glass bowl broke into tiny fragments.

French: Si vous venez visiter New-York, n'hésitez pas à passer à la maison.

French: Les voitures sont arrivées là-bas les unes après les autres.

English: I thought I'd try eating Mexican food today.
French: Je pensais essayer la nourriture mexicaine, aujourd'hui.

English: I thought I'd find you here.

English: You don't want to know.
French: Vous ne voulez pas le savoir.

English: She was supposed to call him at 2:30.
French: Elle était censée l'appeler à quatorze heures trente.

English: I'd like to kiss you.
French: J'aimerais t'embrasser.

English: What are you crunching on?
French: Que grignotes-tu ?

English: Tom is trying to say something.
French: Tom essaie de dire quelque chose.

English: You must kneel at my feet, kiss my hand and swear that I am an angel.
French: Tu dois t'agenouiller à mes pieds, me baiser la main et jurer que je suis un ange.

English: I may outlive you.
French: Il se peut que je vous enterre.

English: This is the place where the battle took place.
French: C'est le lieu où la bataille a eu lieu.

English: The area is built up now.
French: La zone est maintenant en construction.

English: I think it's going to be a nice day.
French: Je pense qu'on va passer une bonne journée.

English: Do you have any idea who did this?
French: Avez-vous la moindre idée de qui l'a fait ?

English: Don't leave them alone.
French: Ne les laissez pas seuls.

English: Tom had to wait three hours.
French: Tom a dû attendre trois heures.

English: That's all I saw.
French: C'est tout ce que j'ai vu.

English: Tom should do as Mary suggests.
French: Tom devrait faire comme Mary le suggère.

English: I am looking forward to seeing you again.
French: Je suis impatient de vous revoir.

English: Is Tom around?
French: Tom est-il dans les environs ?

English: Please promise me that you'll never lie to me again.
French: Promettez-moi, je vous prie, que vous ne me mentirez plus jamais !

English: You don't sound very surprised.
French: À vous entendre, vous n'avez pas l'air très surprise.

English: My car is now being repaired.
French: Ma voiture est actuellement en réparation.

English: He has made up his mind to buy the car.
French: Il s'est décidé à acheter la voiture.

English: I need a new broom. This one's shot.
French: J'ai besoin d'un nouveau balai, celui-ci est foutu.

English: Look at the picture.
French: Regardez ce tableau, s'il vous plaît.

English: You've got to tell Tom how you feel.
French: Vous devez dire à Tom ce que vous ressentez.

English: Who do you trust?
