English: He put the book on the shelf.
French: Il mit le livre sur l'étagère.

English: You're very lonely.
French: Tu es fort solitaire.

English: I have to live on my very small income.
French: Je dois vivre d'un maigre revenu.

English: I don't think being poor is anything to be ashamed of.
French: Je ne crois pas qu'on doive avoir honte d'être pauvre.

English: A man appeared from behind the door.
French: Un homme est apparu derrière la porte.

English: I didn't expect you to turn up here.
French: Je ne m'attendais pas à ce que vous vous montriez ici.

English: Talk to my boss.
French: Parle à mon patron.

English: Make your choice.
French: Fais ton choix.

English: Have you ever grown a beard?
French: T'es-tu déjà laissé pousser la barbe ?

English: How often do you shave?
French: Tous les combien de temps te rases-tu ?

English: The enemy dropped many bombs on the factory.
French: L'ennemi a largué beaucoup de bombes sur l'usine.

English: I heard her sing a song.
French: Je l'ai entendue chanter.

English: That's not even the worst part.
French: Ce n'est même pas la partie la pire.

English: We went due north.
French: Nous sommes partis plein nord.

English: It seems interesting.
French: Ça a l'air intéressant.

English: Do you want to join me for lunch?
French: Veux-tu te joindre à moi pour déjeuner ?

English: Roll down your window.
French: Abaisse ta fenêtre !

English: Take a little nap on the sofa.
French: Fais un roupillon sur le canapé !

English: I wanted to tell you.
French: Je voulais vous le dire.

English: No one was injured.
French: Personne n'a été blessé.

English: Don't give me that look.
French: Ne me jetez pas ce regard !

English: I made her cry.
French: Je la fis pleurer.

English: I'll take some X-rays of your teeth.
French: Je vais faire une radiographie de votre dentition.

English: I haven't finished my breakfast yet.
French: Je n'ai pas encore fini mon déjeuner.

English: I hate this song.
French: Je déteste cette chanson.

English: She is her old self again.
French: Elle est de nouveau elle-même.

English: What's the final count?
French: Quel est le décompte final ?

English: It's a small world.
French: Le monde est petit.

English: He stood there for a while.
French: Il resta ici un moment.

English: The boat sank in a flash.
French: Le bateau sombra en un instant.

English: Do you mind if I stay here?
French: Vois-tu un inconvénient à ce que je reste ici ?

English: Is that really what you want?
French: Est-ce vraiment ce que tu veux ?

English: You're not dead.
French: Vous n'êtes pas mort.

English: I'm wearing my swimsuit under my clothes.
French: Je porte mon maillot de bain sous mes vêtements.

English: Do you think that you would enjoy being famous?

English: If you don't trust them, they won't trust you.
French: Si tu ne te fies pas à eux, ils ne se fieront pas à toi.

English: How did you enjoy the movie?
French: Comment avez-vous trouvé le film ?

English: I'm just lazy.
French: Je suis juste paresseuse.

English: She married a hotshot lawyer from New York.
French: Elle épousa un avocat new-yorkais de haut vol.

English: I don't think they heard us.
French: Je ne pense pas qu'ils nous aient entendus.

English: I had my car stolen last night.
French: On m'a volé ma voiture hier soir.

English: Why are you picking a fight with me?
French: Pourquoi me cherches-tu querelle ?

English: Tom never told me why he wasn't here the day before yesterday.
French: Tom ne m'a jamais dit pourquoi il n'était pas là avant-hier.

English: She is related to him.
French: Elle lui est apparentée.

English: It's been three years since the accident.
French: Cela fait trois ans depuis l'accident.

English: I like to dress this way.
French: J'aime m'habiller de cette façon.

English: Can you show us how to do that?
French: Pouvez-vous nous montrer comment ça marche?

English: It was Mary that bought this skirt yesterday.
French: C'est Mary qui a acheté cette jupe hier.

English: You will soon be convinced I am right.
French: Vous serez bientôt convaincu que j'ai raison.

English: Tom just went on vacation.
French: Tom vient de partir en vacances.

English: I think you're interesting.
French: Je pense que tu es intéressante.

English: Adjust your tie.
French: Ajuste ta cravate !

English: He called me up from Tokyo.
French: Il m'a appelé de Tokyo.

English: I don't have anything else.
French: Je n'ai rien d'autre.

English: He is very sociable.
French: Il est très sociable.

English: I saw somebody.
French: Je vis quelqu'un.

English: I cannot understand what happened.
French: Je n'arrive pas à comprendre ce qui s'est passé.

English: I have some questions I'd like to ask.
French: J'ai quelques questions que j'aimerais poser.

English: I'm not the same fool I was fifteen years ago.
French: Je ne suis plus l'idiot que j'étais il y a quinze ans.

English: This seems kind of expensive.
French: Ça a l'air plutôt cher.

English: How did you meet him?
French: Comment l'as-tu rencontré ?

English: He vowed to give up smoking.
French: Il a exprimé sa volonté d'arrêter la cigarette.

English: You're out of booze.
French: T'a plus de bibine.

English: Will I have the pleasure of seeing you again?
French: Aurai-je le plaisir de te revoir ?

English: Everything is gone.
French: Tout est parti.

English: Put your hands up in the air!
French: Levez les mains en l'air !

English: I'm really shocked.
French: Je suis vraiment choquée.

English: I think we can do this without any extra help.
French: Je pense que nous pouvons le faire sans aucune aide supplémentaire.

English: What would you like to eat?
French: Qu'aimeriez-vous manger ?

English: You're crafty.
French: Tu es rusé.

English: That car is too expensive for me to buy.
French: Cette voiture est trop chère pour que je l'achète.

English: Are you still sleepy?
French: Es-tu encore endormie ?

English: Put your hat back on.
French: Remets ton chapeau.

English: You're with friends.
French: Vous êtes avec des amis.

English: The tank is full.
French: Le réservoir est plein.

English: Don't you think that's a bit odd?
French: Ne pensez-vous pas que ce soit un peu bizarre ?

English: I don't want to regret anything.
French: Je ne veux pas regretter quoi que ce soit.

English: When your friends begin to flatter you on how young you look, it's a sure sign you're getting old.
French: Quand vos amis commencent à vous dire que vous ne faites pas votre âge, c'est le signe infaillible que vous vieillissez.

English: It's not that different.
French: Ce n'est pas si différent.

English: I don't think you're schizophrenic.
French: Je ne pense pas que vous soyez schizophrène.

English: I thought I'd lost you.
French: Je pensais que je vous avais perdu.

English: Which one is more expensive?
French: Laquelle est plus chère ?

English: The government made no move to solve the housing problem.
French: Le gouvernement ne fit rien pour résoudre le problème du logement.

English: Memorize the poem by next week.
French: Apprends le poème par cœur pour la semaine prochaine.

English: A man was complaining of something in a sharp voice.
French: Un homme se plaignait de quelque chose avec une voix aiguë.

English: Few girls can even speak to him.
French: Peu de filles peuvent même lui parler.

English: They're all the same.
French: Ils sont tous les mêmes.

English: We have a lot of earthquakes in Japan.
French: Il y a beaucoup de tremblements de terre au Japon.

English: I'm being careful.
French: Je fais attention.

English: The whole world hungers for peace.
French: Le monde entier aspire à la paix.

English: It goes without saying that smoking is bad for your health.
French: Il va sans dire que fumer est mauvais pour votre santé.

English: Are you waiting for someone?
French: Attendez-vous quelqu'un ?

English: Please find out where she is.
French: Trouve où elle est, s'il te plait.

English: Tom was charged with drunken driving after he was involved in a car accident in Boston.
French: Tom a été accusé de conduite en état d'ébriété après avoir été impliqué dans un accident de voiture à Boston.

English: She liked that.
French: Elle apprécia cela.

English: I don't know why I just did that.
French: J'ignore pourquoi je viens de faire ça.

English: Please look at these papers carefully.
French: Veuillez regarder ces papiers avec soin.

English: My husband is a very good cook.
French: Mon mari est très bon cuisinier.

English: Are you sure you didn't do anything?
French: Es-tu certaine de n'avoir rien fait ?

English: Are you thirsty?
French: As-tu soif ?

English: Do you wear a kimono?
French: Portez-vous un kimono ?

English: Banks open at nine o'clock.
French: Les banques ouvrent à neuf heures.

English: I just had to see you guys before I left.
French: Il fallait que je vous voie, les mecs, avant que je parte.

English: Did they talk to each other?
French: Se sont-ils parlé ?

English: He had the nerve to say that.
French: Il a eu le culot de dire ça.

English: A crazy thing just happened to me.
French: Il vient de m’arriver un truc de fou.

English: When did you get married?
French: Quand vous êtes-vous mariée ?

English: I just had to check on something.
French: Il m'a fallu vérifier quelque chose, un point c'est tout.

English: That's what I figured.
French: C'est ce que je me suis imaginé.

English: I want to see your supervisor.
French: Je veux voir votre contremaître.

English: You're a total wreck.
French: Vous êtes une vraie loque.

English: If Cleopatra's nose had been shorter, the history of the world would be different.
French: Le nez de Cléopâtre eût-il été plus court, l'histoire du monde en eût été changée.

English: I made a huge mistake.
French: J'ai commis une énorme erreur.

English: You're probably too young to understand what's happening.
French: Vous êtes probablement trop jeune pour comprendre ce qui arrive.

English: Do you remember what you were watching?

English: The box is too heavy to carry.
French: La boîte est trop lourde à porter.

English: Are you familiar with the rules of soccer?
French: Connais-tu les règles du football ?

English: Can you pronounce these words?
French: Sais-tu prononcer ces mots ?

English: Don't talk to him about it.
French: Ne lui en parle pas.

English: You're in big trouble.
French: Tu as de gros problèmes.

English: I'm buying a puppy.
French: J'achète un chiot.

English: I don't know how to contact you.
French: Je ne sais pas comment prendre contact avec vous.

English: I'm not saying that you're not beautiful.
French: Je ne dis pas que vous n'êtes pas belle.

English: He knows every inch of this area.
French: Il connaît tout dans ce domaine.

English: Can you do a headstand?
French: Sais-tu te tenir sur la tête ?

English: Are you going to leave?
French: Vas-tu partir ?

English: Meet me at the hotel bar.
French: On se retrouve au bar de l'hôtel !

English: I want to please you.
French: Je veux vous plaire.

English: We all make mistakes.
French: Nous commettons toutes des erreurs.

English: I didn't know you were looking for me.
French: Je ne savais pas que vous me cherchiez.

English: I'll tell you what I know.
French: Je te ferai part de ce que je sais.

English: We were caught in a snowstorm.
French: Nous fûmes pris dans une tempête de neige.

English: It's no easy task to keep up with him.
French: Ce n'est pas tâche facile de le suivre.

English: They hunted foxes.
French: Ils chassaient des renards.

English: They agreed on everything.
French: Elles se sont accordées sur tout.

English: Nobody knows his name.
French: Personne ne sait son nom.

English: I am anxious about his health.
French: Je suis inquiet pour sa santé.

English: You let me down.
French: Vous m'avez déçu.

English: He wanted to succeed.
French: Il voulait réussir.

English: Who knows?

English: I don't like hot tubs.
French: Je n'aime pas les baquets à eau chaude.

English: Children need a lot of sleep.
French: Les enfants ont besoin de beaucoup de sommeil.

English: Was anybody else there?
French: Qui que ce soit d'autre s'y trouvait-il ?

English: Elephants are an endangered species.
French: Les éléphants sont une espèce menacée.

English: We just got here.
French: Nous venons d'arriver.

English: Tom went inside.
French: Tom est allé à l'intérieur.

English: Do you have to do this very often?
French: Dois-tu faire ça très souvent ?

English: Are you sure that you want to go there?
French: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir y aller ?

English: I didn't sleep much last night.
French: Je n'ai guère dormi la nuit dernière.

English: What an attractive woman!
French: Quelle femme séduisante !

English: I can walk no farther.
French: Je ne peux marcher plus loin.

English: Do you have a lot of time to relax?
French: Avez-vous beaucoup de temps pour vous détendre?

English: He developed his own theory.
French: Il a développé sa propre théorie.

English: Where exactly did you go?

English: Let me give you my phone number.
French: Laissez-moi vous donner mon numéro de téléphone.

English: Don't tell my wife.
French: Ne dites rien à mon épouse !

English: Are you blackmailing me?

English: I haven't the foggiest idea.
French: Je n'en ai pas la moindre idée.

English: Do you mind if I help myself?
French: Vois-tu un inconvénient à ce que je me serve ?

English: This table is made out of wood.
French: Cette table est en bois.

English: I met her by chance at a restaurant yesterday.
French: Je l'ai rencontrée par hasard dans un restaurant hier.

English: Cows are eating grass in the meadow.
French: Les vaches paissent dans le pré.

English: I have to change clothes.
French: Il faut que je change de vêtements.

English: I thought I told you to clean your room.
French: Je pensais vous avoir dit de nettoyer votre chambre.

English: I went there for the purpose of meeting him.
French: Je m'y rendis dans le but de le rencontrer.

English: It was below zero this morning, but I cycled to school.
French: La température était négative ce matin, mais je me suis rendu à l'école en vélo.

English: You know I don't dance.
French: Vous savez que je ne danse pas.

English: Tom has changed a lot since then.
French: Tom a beaucoup changé depuis.

English: How awful!
French: C'est affreux !

English: How is the weather today?
French: Comment est le temps aujourd'hui ?

English: She wiped her face with a handkerchief.
French: Elle s'essuya la figure avec un mouchoir.

English: You're very busy.
French: Vous êtes très occupé.

English: You didn't mean it, did you?
French: Ce n'était pas votre intention, si ?

English: My wife is away for the weekend.
French: Mon épouse est partie pour le week-end.

English: Is this your glass or your sister's?
French: Est-ce votre verre ou celui de votre sœur ?

English: I made it myself.
French: Je l'ai confectionné moi-même.

English: Tom is thirty years old.
French: Tom a trente ans.

English: Don't they drive you mad?
French: Ne vous rendent-elles pas fous ?

English: That's all Tom has to say.
French: C'est tout ce que Tom a à dire.

English: You don't have to do that if you don't really want to.
French: Vous n'êtes pas obligé de le faire si vous ne le voulez vraiment pas.

English: If only I could sing well.
French: Si seulement je pouvais bien chanter.

English: This is a new kind of melon.
French: C'est une nouvelle espèce de melon.

English: No man is wise at all times.
French: Personne n'est tout le temps clairvoyant.

English: You did it!
French: C'est vous qui l'avez fait !

English: You look very pale.
French: Vous avez l'air très pâle.

English: He's a slowpoke.
French: C'est un lambin.

English: They look like they're having fun.
French: Ils ont l'air de bien s'amuser.

English: May I lie on the sofa?
French: Est-ce que je peux m'allonger sur le sofa ?

English: I like your hair.
French: J'aime tes cheveux.

English: You're so sweet.
French: Tu es si gentil !

English: Her beauty cast a spell over him.
French: Sa beauté le charma.

English: Tell me why you were absent from school yesterday.
French: Dis-moi pourquoi tu étais absente de l'école hier.

English: I bought this book at the bookstore in front of the station.
French: J'ai acheté ce livre dans la librairie en face de la gare.

English: I met him while I was staying in Paris.
French: Je l’ai rencontré lorsque j’étais à Paris.

English: I've had enough.
French: Ça suffit.

English: Tom left everything to Mary in his will.
French: Tom a tout laissé à Marie dans son testament.

English: I used to love that.
French: J'adorais ça.

English: He acquired French quickly.
French: Il a appris le français rapidement.

English: Tom pulled a box from under the bed.
French: Tom tira une boîte de sous le lit.

English: You're the only one I trust.
French: Tu es la seule en qui j'ai confiance.

English: That is what they study English for.
French: C'est pour ça qu'ils étudient l'anglais.

English: We saw another ship far ahead.
French: On a vu un autre bateau loin en tête.

English: In those days, sugar was less valuable than salt.
French: En ce temps-là, le sucre avait moins de valeur que le sel.

English: How many hotels do you think there are in Boston?
French: Combien d'hôtels penses-tu qu'il y a à Boston ?

English: This apple tastes sour.
French: Cette pomme a un goût amer.

English: She greeted us with a smile.
French: Elle nous accueillit d'un sourire.

English: I can't believe that you aren't at least willing to consider the possibility of other alternatives.
French: Je n'arrive pas à croire que vous ne soyez pas tout au moins disposée à envisager d'autres possibilités.

English: Would you like to come over to my place?
French: Voulez-vous venir chez moi?

English: I haven't found a doctor yet.
French: Je n'ai pas encore trouvé de médecin.

English: Whoever did this was smart.
French: Quiconque l'a fait était malin.

English: Did you see what I did?
French: Avez-vous vu ce que j'ai fait ?

English: Where's the nearest shopping mall?
French: Où se trouve le centre commercial le plus proche?

English: I've already fed the baby.
French: J'ai déjà nourri le bambin.

English: Tom mistakenly ate his entree with his salad fork.
French: Tom a mangé par erreur son entrée avec sa fourchette à salade.

English: I have another engagement.
French: J'ai une autre obligation.

English: You know where to find me if you need anything.
French: Tu sais où me trouver si tu as besoin de quoi que ce soit.

English: English is not my mother tongue.
French: L'anglais n'est pas ma langue natale.

English: We're kind of busy here.
French: Nous sommes plutôt occupées, ici.

English: I just want tonight to be special.
French: Je veux simplement que la soirée d'aujourd'hui soit spéciale.

English: I heard the song sung in French.
French: J'ai entendu cette chanson en version française.

English: I haven't seen you in ages.
French: Je ne t'ai pas vu depuis des lustres.

English: Tom is blind.
French: Tom est aveugle.

English: He hanged himself.
French: Il s'est pendu.

English: Tom lives next door to us.
French: Tom habite la porte à côté.

English: I know who you are.
French: Je sais qui vous êtes.

English: My father disapproved of my going to the concert.
French: Mon père s'est opposé à ce que j'aille au concert.

English: My apartment is more comfortable than yours.
French: Mon appartement est plus confortable que le tien.

English: I really wish I knew how to do that.
French: J'aimerais vraiment savoir faire ça.

English: My father used to read books to me at bedtime.
French: Mon père avait l'habitude de me lire des livres au moment du coucher.

English: I looked all over for Tom.
French: J'ai cherché Tom partout.

English: I thought you'd be full after eating that big steak.
French: Je pensais que vous seriez rassasiés après avoir mangé ce gros steak.

English: I know I have a biased opinion.
French: Je sais que j'ai une opinion biaisée.

English: I'd like to live in New York.
French: J'aimerais vivre à New York.

English: He got his car washed at the filling station.
French: Il a fait laver sa voiture à la station-essence.

English: She has seen better days.
French: Elle a connu de meilleurs jours.

English: I don't like to see food go to waste.
French: Je n'aime pas voir de la nourriture gaspillée.

English: Don't you see what's happened?
French: Ne vois-tu pas ce qui est arrivé ?

English: I'm done with my chores.
French: J'en ai fini avec mes corvées.

English: I thought I was alone.
French: Je pensais être seul.

English: Tom was a great help to me.
French: Tom me fut d'un grand secours.

English: He gave a deep sigh.
French: Il soupira profondément.

English: May I leave this book with you?
French: Je te laisse ce livre ?

English: We're undressing.
French: Nous nous déshabillons.

English: I have nothing to say in this regard.
French: À cet égard, je n'ai rien à dire.

English: She left with her friends.
French: Elle est partie avec ses amis.

English: Ask her when she comes back.
French: Demande-lui quand elle reviendra.

English: He is the only child they have.
French: C'est le seul enfant qu'ils aient.

English: He closed the door suddenly.
French: Il ferma soudain la porte.

English: What trouble can he cause?
French: Quels problèmes peut-il causer ?

English: I'm the one who killed Tom.
French: Je suis celui qui a tué Tom.

English: Every man cannot be a good pianist.
French: Tout le monde ne peut pas être un bon pianiste.

English: He has to have his blood pressure taken every day.
French: On doit lui prendre sa pression artérielle chaque jour.

English: Please give me something to eat.
French: S'il vous plaît, donnez-moi à manger.

English: I'm afraid I have to ask you to leave.
French: J'ai bien peur de devoir vous demander de partir.

English: It wasn't possible for the boy to swim across the river.
French: Il était impossible pour le garçon de traverser la rivière à la nage.

English: Have you ever eaten at that restaurant?
French: Avez-vous jamais mangé à ce restaurant-là ?

English: There is no room for doubt about his guilt.
French: Sa culpabilité ne laisse aucun doute.

English: Somebody needs to be here for the children.
French: Il faut que quelqu'un soit là pour les enfants.

English: You never get my jokes.
French: Tu ne saisis jamais mes plaisanteries.

English: That's worth remembering.
French: Cela vaut la peine que l'on s'en souvienne.

English: I like the smell of bread just out of the oven.
French: J'aime l'odeur du pain tout juste sorti du four.

English: Do Japanese people eat sushi every day?
French: Les japonais, ils mangent des sushis tous les jours ?

English: What grade did you get on the test?

English: You're not staying here, are you?

English: We need an answer.

English: They're just students.

English: I hate these words.

English: It took me two hours to memorize this sentence.

English: Cabbage can be eaten raw.

English: Hold your breath, please.

English: I just want us to stay together.

English: Are you still not convinced?

French: Elle pleura tant et plus mais personne ne vint la réconforter.

English: Can I use your pencil?

French: Je sais que ce n'est pas vrai, mais il semble vraiment que le Soleil tourne autour de la Terre.

French: Il m'a promis qu'il ne le dirait à personne.

English: I do want to go with you.

English: I have no patience.

English: Tom crossed the street.

English: How long does it take from here to the station?

English: We're not friends anymore.

English: Can you do it faster?

French: Il est improbable que notre équipe gagne.

English: They trusted you.

English: I want to want what you want.

English: I know how busy you are.

English: Sooner or later, his luck will run out.

English: I was speechless.

English: My bicycle has a flat tire.

English: You're not finished.

English: Let me borrow that.

English: Men do not exist in this world to become rich, but to become happy.
French: Les hommes ne sont pas en ce monde pour devenir riches, mais pour devenir heureux.

English: Wipe your shoes on the mat.

French: Nous allâmes tôt au théâtre, de sorte que nous puissions être assurés que chacun puisse disposer d'un fauteuil.

French: Dans le jargon de l'immobilier, un « rêve pour bricoleur » signifie généralement que l'endroit est une vraie décharge.

French: Je suis désolée de ne pas vous avoir écrit pendant aussi longtemps.

English: You can't trust anything he says.

French: Elle fait un point d'honneur à toujours arriver parfaitement en retard.

English: The walls were painted light brown.

French: Je sais qu'il est assez tard mais cela te dérangerait-il que je vienne chez toi maintenant ? J'ai quelque chose qu'il me faut discuter avec toi.

French: Le livre de Tom, sur sa vie avec Mary, s'est vendu comme des petits pains.

French: Elle se rend chez le dentiste régulièrement, donc elle a rarement des maux de dents.

English: When will you be back?

English: It will make little difference whether you go there by taxi or on foot.

English: How long will this rain go on?

English: You're such a liar.

English: Everyone deserves a second chance.

English: It goes without saying that health is most important.

English: I promise I'll call.

English: It's no use pleading because they'll never give in.

English: We are entering a new phase in the war.

English: There's no way to get in touch with him.

English: The Japanese government can't cope with the problem.

English: You'd love it.

English: It's a lot more difficult than that.

English: Tom keeps his word.

English: You're scaring the kids.

English: Tom showed up at just the right moment.

English: Thanks to you, I spent all my money.

English: I mean it!

English: How strange life is!

English: Read this book at your leisure.

English: Tom went outside to smoke a cigarette.

English: They are alone.

English: Is there something in particular that you want to know?

English: No one really knows.

English: I'm on a budget, so I don't eat out more than three times a week.
French: Comme j'ai un budget à respecter, je vais au restaurant pas plus de trois fois par semaine.

English: He is an ideal husband for me.

English: I want to get there early so we can get good seats.

English: Tom knows he's right.

English: Why did you buy a flower?

English: Keep your eye on him.

English: He tried getting close to her using every means possible.

English: We'll all die sooner or later.

English: I hope we didn't wake you.

English: I pay most of my bills on the first of each month.

English: I did find something.

English: I must have misunderstood.

English: There is little hope of success.

English: Kids are cruel.

English: I almost shot you.

English: If I had had enough money, I would have bought that computer.

English: You can't tell anyone about this.

English: I need your full attention now.

English: A map helps us to know where we are.

English: I don't care whether he leaves or stays.

English: He is not too poor to buy a bicycle.

English: Are all of them your friends?

English: The place is surrounded by cops.

English: You can always text Tom.

English: Would you like to try it again?

English: I love the way you kiss.

English: You remind me of your brother.

English: You're first.

English: You'd better not stay up too late.

English: He went out a little before five o'clock.
French: Il alla l'extérieur un petit peu avant cinq heures.

English: We can't keep this up for much longer.

English: Tom doesn't like to be made to wait.
French: Tom n'aime pas qu'on l'oblige à attendre.

English: I've made my choice.

English: He avoids me.

English: The supplies are beginning to give out.

English: I don't eat breakfast.

English: I know none of them.

English: I can't believe you bought this.

English: There's something I want to discuss with you.

English: Tom looked at his appointment book.
French: Tom regarda son agenda.

English: You look busy.

English: I don't know if that means anything.

English: We're pretty tight.

English: She is frightened of thunder.

English: Don't let that bother you.

English: The joke's on you.

English: You must accept your role.

English: Do you mind if I go?

English: The mirror is on top of the dresser.
French: Le miroir se trouve sur le dessus du vaisselier.

English: No one was there.
French: Personne n'était là.

English: I have two brothers and one sister.
French: J'ai deux frères et une sœur.

English: Who is sitting at the other end of the table?
French: Qui est assis là à l'autre bout de la table ?

English: If you can digest them, raw vegetables are good for your health.
French: Si on peut les digérer, les légumes crus font du bien à la santé.

English: Do you know what this is all about?

English: We're trying.

English: The students disobeyed their teacher.
French: Les élèves désobéirent à leur instituteur.

English: How do I make you go away?

English: I know your mother.

English: I can't stand getting beaten.

French: Comment votre matinée s'est-elle passée ?

English: Are you a cop?

English: He is considered one of the greatest scientists in our country.
French: Il est considéré comme l'un des meilleurs scientifiques du pays.

English: I wonder who that girl is.

English: I wish you had come with us.

French: Elle a essayé diverses méthodes pour maigrir.

English: I will leave it to your judgement.

English: Let's sit here for a while.

English: We were held up for two hours on account of an accident.
French: Nous avons été retenus pendant deux heures en raison d'un accident.

English: I told you it was going to be cold here.

English: Tom has decided to have the surgery that his doctor recommended.
French: Tom a décidé de subir l'opération que le médecin lui a recommandée.

English: Everybody knew she could speak English well.
French: Tout le monde savait qu'elle pouvait parler très bien anglais.

English: He grows vegetables in his garden.
French: Il fait pousser des légumes dans son jardin.

English: Did you bring the book?

English: I think you might be overreacting.

English: We're completely lost.

English: I want a match. Do you have one?

English: We met at summer camp.

English: The money is at your disposal.

English: There is a marked difference between them.
French: Entre les deux, il y a une énorme différence.

English: You must be in good physical condition.

English: It won't work.

English: I shouldn't have done this.

English: I want to be certain you are who you say you are.

English: Why do all the cool things happen to you?

English: I have errands to run.

English: She persuaded him to marry her.

English: You don't have to explain.

English: Tomorrow is Christmas Day.

English: Do you go to school by bus?

English: Are you finished?

English: What was he doing here?

English: Forget your sorrows.

English: I ran away in a hurry.

English: Did you wash your hands?

English: Are you in favor of the new law?

English: London was bombed several times.

English: Our apple tree is blooming.

English: I want to talk to you about this report.

English: Your secret's safe with us.

English: The sky became darker and darker.

English: They awarded her a gold metal for her achievement.
French: Ils lui attribuèrent une médaille d'or pour son accomplissement.

English: I'm so tired!

English: I need it yesterday.

English: If that happens, call me.

English: I could hardly hear him.

English: How about dining out tonight?

English: Why didn't you tell someone?

English: I don't ever want to talk about it.

English: I've warned you before about this.

English: What is this place?

English: We need to cut costs.

English: I was never worried about you.

English: Where did you learn to shoot?

English: Glasses and dishes were broken.

English: I'll be more than happy to help.

English: I'm looking after myself.

English: I forgot to tell them.

English: Something must have happened to him on the way.

English: It's very expensive.

English: I think he will come to our party.

English: He finally bent to my wishes.

English: Your phone is ringing again.

English: They aren't alone.

English: I should have told you before.

English: I love music, too.

English: It's easy if you try.

English: That's altogether wrong.

English: Excuse me, but do you mind if ask your name?

English: She came into the room.
French: Elle est entrée dans la pièce.

English: He thinks he knows best.

English: We decorated the room ourselves.

English: I have some very bad news.

English: I bought that book for Tom.

English: I hate my roommate.

English: Tom has chosen you.

English: Did I hear you talking to someone?

English: Do I look happy to you?

English: This is the longest novel that I have ever read.
French: C'est le plus long roman que j'ai jamais lu.

English: I paid five dollars to him.

English: Don't forget that.

English: I don't have to listen to that.

English: What is the purpose of education?

English: He has trouble remembering names.

English: Language is the means by which people communicate with others.

English: I don't like your attitude.

English: Get out of my way.

English: He has three older sisters.

English: A bad cold prevented her from attending the class.

English: There's a party going on in the next room.
French: Une fête se déroule dans la pièce d'à côté.

English: Something happened here, but I don't know what.
French: Quelque chose s'est passé ici, mais j'ignore quoi.

English: The school was established in 1650.
French: Cette école a été fondée en 1650.

English: Since I had a slight fever, I stayed in bed.
French: Comme j'avais un peu de fièvre, je restai au lit.

English: I suppose you've already bought a ticket.
French: Je suppose que tu as déjà acheté un billet.

English: The hunter shot a bear.

English: It is your constant efforts that count most in the end.
French: Ce sont vos constants efforts qui importent en fin de compte.

English: They broke out into spontaneous laughter.
French: Ils éclatèrent d'un rire naturel.

English: Who's had enough?

English: There is a small pond in our garden.
French: Notre jardin comporte un petit étang.

English: I don't like anything.
French: Je n'aime rien.

English: Would you please autograph this book?
French: Tu pourrais dédicacer ce livre, s'il te plaît ?

English: Tom doesn't want to get his hands dirty.
French: Tom ne veut pas se salir les mains.

English: What time did your friend go home?
French: À quelle heure votre ami est-il rentré chez lui ?

English: He donated countless pieces to the museum.

English: I must know the truth.

English: If you get into difficulties, don't hesitate to ask for advice.

English: I'm adding the last touch.
French: Je suis en train d'ajouter la dernière touche.

English: I slept with the light off.
French: J'ai dormi avec la lumière éteinte.

English: The boy who lives next door often comes home late.
French: Le garçon d'à côté ne rentre souvent que tard à la maison.

English: I am interested in taking pictures.
French: Prendre des photos m'intéresse.

English: Tom doesn't know where to look.

English: He was unconscious for three days.
French: Il resta inconscient durant trois jours.

English: She's only two years old, but she can already count to 100.
French: Elle n'a que deux ans, mais elle peut déjà compter jusqu'à 100.

English: Who caused the accident?

English: It makes no difference to me whether she is rich or not.
French: Pour moi ça ne fait aucune difference qu'elle soit riche ou pas.

English: You're totally ignorant.

English: Here are the tickets.

English: He has the backing of a certain politician.
French: Il a l'appui d'un certain politicien.

English: He has a remarkable memory.
French: Il a une mémoire remarquable.

English: Come into my room.
French: Entrez dans ma chambre.

English: Tom wants to get married again.
French: Tom veut se remarier.

English: He was deserted by his friends.

English: It won't be hard.
French: Ce ne sera pas difficile.

English: I didn't hear what you said.

English: We need authorization.

English: Can I get something to eat?

English: I'm ticklish.

English: Tom needs us to show him the way.

English: I'm visiting my grandmother in the hospital.

English: Everyone is staring at Tom.

English: We'll have to pull an all-nighter.

English: Which of you will try it first?

English: You are not supposed to smoke here.

English: Money does not grow on trees.

English: We are the same age, but different heights.

English: I just want to be a good neighbor.

English: They were worried about getting caught.
French: Elles étaient inquiètes de se faire prendre.

English: She spends way too much time surfing the web.
French: Elle passe carrément trop de temps à surfer sur le web.

English: We'll stand.

English: If there's anything I can do for you, please let me know.
French: S'il y a quoi que ce soit que je puisse faire pour vous, je vous prie de me le faire savoir.

English: What are you going to do this evening?

English: I'll bear that in mind.
French: Je garderai ça en tête.

English: The fire went out.

English: Heed public opinion.

English: The desk has three drawers.

English: They'll be rooting for you.

English: Don't get on the train yet.

English: I'm waiting for my mother.

English: It's the first thing that I do in the morning.

English: I'll pray hard.

English: Earth is a beautiful planet.
French: La Terre est une belle planète.

English: Black coats are in fashion this winter.

English: I'm proud of the work I've done here.
French: Je suis fière du travail que j'ai accompli ici.

English: Why don't you tell me the way you think it happened?

English: If you get enough rest every night, you'll feel much better.

English: My mother told me I needed to eat less candy.

English: Do you know who that tall blonde girl in green is?

English: I remember that feeling.

English: You're on the list.

English: I didn't change a thing.

English: He asked his friends for help.

English: They announced that they were going to have a party.

English: She is teaching us French.

English: What on earth are you doing here?

English: He broke the rules.

English: That job is impossible for me to do.

English: Alcohol consumption is increasing every year.

English: I just don't want to die.

English: If you are not satisfied with your share, I'll make it a bit more attractive.
French: Si tu n'es pas satisfait de ton lot, je le rendrai un peu plus attractif.

English: The two boys look more alike than I thought.

English: We have many purchases to make.

English: They're not always right.

English: You're selfish.

English: I didn't shoot anyone.

English: I'm busy at the moment.

English: Are you sure you're warm enough?

English: We don't have the time.

English: That cost a lot of money.

English: Tom, do you still love me?

English: He is still full of energy.

English: Check, please.

English: There is no sugar here.

English: I have something for you, too.

English: Don't let him know her address.

English: You're talkative.

English: Don't treat me like I'm stupid.

English: I wish I had seen the film.

English: I want to keep a cat instead of a dog.

English: No matter who says so, it's not true.

English: I like watching TV.

English: Will he be able to come tomorrow?

English: I won't be here that long.

English: I think you look hot.

French: Tom et Marie ont tous les deux commencés à rire.

English: Tom took Mary's money.

English: Tom dried his hands with a small towel.
French: Tom s'est essuyé les mains avec une petite serviette.

English: He lived a happy life.

English: I think it's time for me to put new bait on the hook.
French: Je pense qu'il est temps que je mette un nouvel appât à l'hameçon.

English: Can you please shut up?

English: He can't come with us.

English: I really doubt it.

English: They made me go there.
French: Ils me forcèrent à y aller.

English: I found this under your bed.
French: J'ai trouvé ceci sous votre lit.

English: Tom stopped reading for a moment.
French: Tom a cessé de lire pendant un moment.

English: Don't get too excited.

English: People say that he is the richest man in this town.
French: Les gens disent qu'il est l'homme le plus riche de la ville.

English: You have no right to go there.
French: Vous n'avez pas le droit d'aller là.

English: Everything is possible.

English: Do you play in a band?

English: I am sorry for you.
French: Je suis désolé pour toi.

English: He came downstairs.
French: Il est descendu.

English: We found a poor little cat in the yard.
French: Nous avons trouvé un pauvre petit chat dans la cour.

English: Go back to your room.
French: Retourne dans ta chambre !

English: This is my cat.
French: C'est mon chat.

English: I observed that his hands were unsteady.
French: Je notai que ses mains tremblaient.

English: I want you to have a copy of this.
French: Je veux que tu aies une copie de ceci.

English: I can't take another step.

English: He is very angry.

English: Better to err on the side of caution.

English: I often go fishing in that river.
French: Je vais souvent pêcher dans cette rivière.

English: Like I said, no problem.

English: I've really missed you.
French: Tu me manquais vraiment.

English: It's the biggest house in the neighborhood.
French: C'est la plus grande maison du voisinage.

English: We're not getting any younger.

English: I had to face this alone.
French: J'ai dû y faire face seule.

English: Do you feel up to it?

English: Hold this.

English: I will quit smoking for good.
French: Je vais arrêter de fumer pour de bon.

English: Why did you become a police officer?
French: Pourquoi êtes-vous devenu agent de police ?

English: Who are we competing against?
French: Avec qui sommes-nous en concurrence ?

English: You were watching, weren't you?
French: Vous étiez en train de regarder, n'est-ce pas ?

English: You're afraid that I'm right, aren't you?

English: Where do you get off telling me that?

English: He is sure to pass the exam if he studies at this rate.
French: Il est certain de réussir l'examen s'il étudie à ce rythme.

English: Tom usually comes on time.
French: Habituellement Tom vient à l'heure.

English: Tom told us about what he did in Boston.
French: Tom nous a raconté ce qu'il avait fait à Boston.

English: Men are pigs.
French: Les hommes sont des égoïstes.

English: They announced that they were getting a divorce.
French: Ils annoncèrent qu'ils allaient divorcer.

English: He just returned from abroad.
French: Il vient de rentrer de l'étranger.

English: I've been sober for three years.
French: Je suis sobre depuis trois ans.

English: Start writing.
French: Commence à écrire.

English: Why don't you start by telling us who went with you?
French: Pourquoi ne commencez-vous pas par nous dire qui est allé avec vous ?

English: Did I touch a nerve?

English: We're just going to talk.
French: Nous allons simplement discuter.

English: Tom wants me to stay away from him.
French: Tom veut que je reste éloigné de lui.

English: That's wise.

English: You can't give up on your dreams.

English: This window is bulletproof.

English: I really misjudged you.

English: He often goes to Tokyo.
French: Il va souvent à Tokyo.

English: Let's discuss that problem later.
French: Discutons de ce problème plus tard.

English: I'd like to try doing this without your help.
French: J'aimerais essayer de le faire sans votre aide.

English: I don't know what I'm going to do with you.
French: Je ne sais pas ce que je vais faire avec vous.

English: Both of them started laughing.
French: Toutes les deux se mirent à rire.

English: I went to elementary school in Nagoya.
French: Je suis allé à l'école primaire à Nagoya.

English: I have nothing to do with that case.
French: Je n'ai rien à voir avec cette affaire.

English: I know what those books are like.

English: Here's your milk.

English: In autumn, leaves change color and fall.
French: En automne, les feuilles changent de couleur et choient.

English: Sit down and shut up.
French: Assoyez-vous et taisez-vous !

English: Everybody was startled.
French: Tout le monde a été surpris.

English: We'll join you shortly.

English: Thanks for reminding me.
French: Merci de m'y faire penser.

English: Please don't speak so fast.
French: S'il te plaît, ne parle pas si vite.

English: Is Tom your name?
French: Tu t'appelles bien Tom ?

English: I love my home.
French: J'adore mon chez-moi.

English: Where are my slippers?
French: Où sont mes savates ?

English: You like olives, don't you?
French: Vous aimez les olives, n'est-ce pas ?

English: He did it without me knowing.
French: Il l'a fait sans que je le sache.

English: He is cool, isn't he?
French: Il est cool, pas vrai ?

English: I called him Tom.
French: Je l'ai appelé Tom.

English: He flew a kite.
French: Il faisait voler un cerf-volant.

English: My sister is older than my brother.
French: Ma sœur est plus âgée que mon frère.

English: You should not talk back like that.
French: Vous ne devriez pas répondre de la sorte.

English: That should've been expected.
French: Cela aurait dû être prévu.

English: Maybe Tom won't go to Boston on this trip.
French: Peut-être Tom n'ira-t-il pas à Boston durant ce voyage.

English: You're still too young to get a driver's license.
French: Tu es trop jeune encore pour obtenir un permis de conduire.

French: Elle est assise dans la cuisine, à boire du thé.

French: Bien que les programmeurs utilisent quotidiennement les points-virgules, la plupart des gens les utilisent de nos jours seulement pour les émoticônes.

French: Je veux juste te rendre la pareille.

English: Tom's good at his job.

English: I wasn't able to remember the title of that song.

French: Elle lui recommanda de prendre de longues vacances, il quitta donc immédiatement le travail et partit en voyage autour du monde.

English: Give me your telephone number.
French: Donne-moi ton numéro de téléphone.

English: I'm more experienced than Tom.

French: Tom mange régulièrement des sushis avec sa mère.

English: How could I resist?

English: I had a headache.

French: Elle dit qu'elle n'a pas l'intention d'avoir de bébés jusqu'à ce qu'elle soit dans sa trentaine.

French: Elles se sont précipitées sur le lieu de l'accident.

English: When is he expected back?

French: Nous avons invité dix couples à la fête.

English: Excuse me, but could you scoot over a little bit, please?
French: Peux-tu te mettre un peu de côté, s'il te plait ?

English: I want that book.

English: I helped my mother with the cooking.

English: I know you're scared.

English: I have no idea what that could be.

English: Don't be sad.

English: What is your date of birth?
French: Quelle est ta date de naissance ?

English: Do you have a problem?

English: She steered our efforts in the right direction.
French: Elle a dirigé nos efforts dans la bonne direction.

English: I'm a farmer.
French: Je suis agriculteur.

English: I like short poems.
French: J'aime les petits poèmes.

English: He asked me to return the money to him immediately.
French: Il me demanda de lui rendre l'argent immédiatement.

English: You don't have to be so rude.

English: Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood.
French: Les femmes sont censées être aimées, pas comprises.

English: Did you get fired from your last job?
French: Vous êtes-vous fait virer de votre dernier emploi ?

English: Are you going to buy a dictionary?

English: I'm glad we saw Tom.
French: Je suis content que nous ayons vu Tom.

English: We need to do this report again.
French: Nous devons refaire ce rapport.

English: Will you have another slice of pie? "Yes, please."
French: « Désirez-vous un autre morceau de gâteau ? » « Oui, s'il vous plait. »

English: Are you crazy?
French: Es-tu folle ?

English: Why don't you remember?
French: Pourquoi ne vous le rappelez-vous pas ?

English: My friend copied my homework and the teacher found out.
French: Mon copain a copié mes devoirs et le prof s'en est aperçu.

English: Tom died three weeks ago after being bitten by a cobra.
French: Tom est mort il y a trois semaines d'une morsure de cobra.

English: I thought you'd been killed. I'm glad I was wrong.
French: Je pensais que tu serais tué. Je me réjouis d'avoir eu tort.

English: Take my advice!
French: Écoute mon conseil !

English: The rumor was baseless.
French: La rumeur ne reposait pas sur des faits.

English: This is my question.
French: C'est ma question.

English: You should have seen me.
French: Tu aurais dû me voir !

English: I always drive at a moderate speed.
French: Je conduis toujours à une vitesse modérée.

English: Never take a blind man's arm. Let him take yours.
French: Ne prenez jamais le bras d'un aveugle. Laissez-le prendre le vôtre.

English: That can be a problem.
French: Cela peut être un problème.

English: They are much taller than us.
French: Ils sont beaucoup plus grands que nous.

English: You're nuts!
French: T'es dingue !

English: Is this really what you want to do?
French: Est-ce là réellement ce que tu veux faire ?

English: The Seine flows through Paris.
French: La Seine coule à travers Paris.

English: Man is the only animal that possesses language.
French: L'homme est le seul animal qui possède le langage.

English: I had things to take care of.
French: J'ai eu des choses dont il fallait prendre soin.

English: He is a doctor by profession.
French: Son métier est médecin.

English: That's just crazy.
French: C'est tout simplement fou.

English: This is your fault.
French: C'est votre faute.

English: Now that I have enough money, I can get that camera.
French: Maintenant que j'ai suffisamment d'argent, je peux m'acheter cet appareil photo.

English: I'll never forgive you as long as I live.
French: Je ne vous oublierai jamais, aussi longtemps que je vivrai.

English: I'm sorry, I didn't hear you.
French: Je suis désolé, je ne vous ai pas entendue.

English: If there's anything you want to do, you should do it.
French: S'il y a quoi que ce soit que vous vouliez faire, vous devriez le faire.

English: Once upon a time, there lived a stingy old man in the village.
French: Il était une fois un vieil homme avare qui vivait au village.

English: I like rice more than bread.
French: J'aime le riz davantage que le pain.

English: You're invited.
French: Tu es invité.

English: We're not serious.
French: Nous ne sommes pas sérieuses.

English: Everybody was startled.
French: Tout le monde fut surpris.

English: I know my father will help me.
French: Je sais que mon père va m'aider.

English: I made an appointment to see him at seven o'clock.
French: J'ai pris rendez-vous pour le voir à sept heures.

English: I'll let you know when I need you.
French: Je te ferai savoir lorsque j'aurai besoin de toi.

English: She advised him to go there alone.
French: Elle lui a conseillé de s'y rendre seul.

English: What are you doing in my office?
French: Que fais-tu dans mon bureau ?

English: She painted the wall red.
French: Elle a peint le mur en rouge.

English: Tom hasn't been married long.
French: Tom n'est pas marié depuis longtemps.

English: Their daughter is a nurse.
French: Leur fille est infirmière.

English: You're not very funny.
French: Tu n'es pas très amusant.

English: Our ownership in the company is 60%.
French: Notre part dans cette entreprise s'élève à soixante pour cent.

English: It will cost you $100 to fly to the island.
French: Cela te coutera 100$ pour un vol vers l'île.

English: Have you ever eaten at that restaurant?
French: As-tu jamais mangé à ce restaurant ?

English: Why are you so happy?
French: Pourquoi êtes-vous si heureux ?

English: I guess that she is 40.

English: The old man was accompanied by his grandchild.
French: Le vieil homme fut accompagné par son petit-enfant.

English: I don't know what that is.
French: J'ignore ce que c'est.

English: I was deeply affected when I heard of his death.
French: Je fus profondément affecté lorsque j'appris son décès.

English: I'll be with you in a few minutes.
French: Je serai à toi dans quelques minutes.

English: I'm still dubious.
French: Je suis encore sceptique.

English: I realized I couldn't win.
French: Je pris conscience que je ne pouvais l'emporter.

English: Find the cat.

English: The man blushed.

English: I like the mountains more than I like the sea.

English: It was so hot that I thought I was going to pass out.
French: Il faisait tellement chaud que je pensais que j'allais m'évanouir.

English: He denies having done it.

English: He is fatter than when I last saw him.

English: He caught a large trout.

English: He is a man of few words, but he always keeps his promise.
French: C'est un homme qui parle peu, mais qui tient toujours ses promesses.

English: He is the greatest living artist.
French: C'est le plus grand artiste vivant.

English: Is that what Tom meant?

English: They're stalling.

English: I don't know what I was thinking.

English: I'm not old enough.

English: How long did he live in Ankara?

English: We're sinking.

English: I'm an artist.

English: I love him despite his faults.

English: I don't like the way she speaks to me.

English: It'll cost me my job.

English: Tom often wears tie-dyed T-shirts.
French: Tom porte souvent des T-shirts tie-dye.

English: Tom loves to sing.

English: She pointed her finger at him accusingly.
French: Elle pointa son doigt vers lui d'un air accusateur.

English: Are you American?

English: There's a spring in the center of the village.
French: Il y a une source au centre du village.

English: Don't take any chances.

French: Il était assis à lire un livre.

English: Enjoy your evening.

English: You can go to the station by bus.

English: Tom was my cellmate.

English: When you've finished reading that book, I'd like to read it.

English: I went to bed early because I was tired.

French: Le Président Barack Obama a loué la Pologne comme exemple pour les démocraties en devenir au Moyen-Orient et ailleurs.

English: It was a mistake to refuse his assistance.

English: I never should've let you go home alone last night.

French: Je me suis renseigné sur le livre dans plusieurs magasins.

English: I'm no saint.

English: I'm very glad to see you again.

French: Il est tombé amoureux de sa meilleure amie.

French: Demandons à Tom pourquoi il était en retard.

English: I can't get over how different the weather is here.

English: Tom is just trying to make ends meets.
French: Tom essaie juste de joindre les deux bouts.

English: Take a walk.

English: That's a very good suggestion.

English: Just ignore it.

English: He was very nervous.

English: She stared him in the face.
French: Elle le regarda droit dans les yeux.

English: Oranges grow in warm countries.
French: Les oranges poussent dans les pays chauds.

English: They're here for me.
French: Ils sont là pour moi.

English: She likes to go to the library.
French: Elle aime se rendre à la bibliothèque.

English: I had a really great time with your family.
French: J'ai vraiment passé du bon temps avec votre famille.

French: Mon rêve est d'étudier à l'étranger.

English: I'm falling in love with you.
French: Je suis en train de tomber amoureux de toi.

English: I was drinking milk.

English: I quite agree with you.

French: Presque la seule fois où un gros homme perd son sang-froid est lorsqu'on le prive de sa nourriture.

French: Je paierais volontiers davantage pour quelque chose si c'est de qualité élevée.

English: Tom goes swimming almost every day.
French: Tom va nager presque tous les jours.

English: This is the very dictionary I've been looking for.

English: Can I have your telephone number?

English: How long are they?

French: Cette tradition date de temps immémoriaux.

French: Je ne peux pas te dire exactement combien de temps ça prendra.

English: How far is it from here to your school? "It's about ten minute's walk."
French: Combien de temps ça prend pour aller d'ici à ton école ? "Environ 10 minutes à pied."

French: Tom sortit un crayon.

English: I can't tell you. It's a secret and if I told you, it wouldn't be a secret anymore.
French: Je ne peux pas te le dire. C'est un secret et si je te le disais, ce ne serait plus un secret.

English: I can't see anything from here.

English: This proverb is worth remembering.
French: Ce proverbe vaut la peine qu'on s'en souvienne.

English: Tom gave his father a tie on Father's Day.
French: Tom a donné une cravate à son père le jour de la fête des pères.

French: Il a acheté une paire de chaussures noires hier.

English: How did you become interested in studying languages?
French: Comment en es-tu venue à t'intéresser à l'étude des langues ?

English: The North won the Battle of Shiloh.
French: C'est le Nord qui a vaincu lors de la Bataille de Shiloh.

English: How is your last name written?

English: The baby was sound asleep.

English: I cry every day.

English: Don't tell me what I know.

English: What's this?

French: Tom est maintenant en prison.

English: It's true that he is in love with her.

French: Cette année va être prospère.

English: When will we reach the airport?

English: You shouldn't say that kind of thing when children are around.

English: They don't despise you.

English: I forgot my email address.

English: What time are you coming back?

English: I've been asked to forward this message to you.
French: On m'a demandé de vous transmettre ce message.

English: I love the taste of watermelon.
French: J’aime le goût des pastèques.

English: I find you irresistible.

English: Are you an only child?

French: Il a toujours été fidèle à sa femme.

English: I cut the article out of the magazine.

English: I had to change the plan.
French: J'ai dû changer le plan.

English: He seems to know us.

English: I'd like to give you something.

English: I could smell the alcohol on his breath.
French: Je pouvais sentir l'alcool de son haleine.

English: At last, you've hit the nail on the head!
French: Enfin, vous avez mis le doigt dessus !

English: I'm afraid I've offended you.

English: We're going to eat right now.

English: He accused me of having stolen his watch.
French: Il m'accusa d'avoir dérobé sa montre.

English: I'm glad that makes you happy.
French: Je suis content que ça te rende heureuse.

English: Is that our problem?

English: I hadn't thought of that.

English: I don't believe you.
French: Je ne te crois pas.

English: Where's your school?

English: Can you lend me a little money?
French: Pouvez-vous me prêter un peu d'argent?

English: I know you did that.
French: Je sais que vous l'avez fait.

English: I'd like to ask you a few questions if you don't mind.
French: J'aimerais vous poser quelques questions, si vous n'y voyez pas d'inconvénient.

English: The party ended at nine.
French: La fête s'est terminée à neuf heures.

English: It is important to know your own limitations.
French: C'est important de connaître ses propres limites.

English: I don't think I can help you.
French: Je ne pense pas arriver à t'aider.

English: I'll have it here for you tomorrow.
French: Je le tiendrai à votre disposition, ici, demain.

English: He studied the way birds fly.
French: Il étudiait le vol des oiseaux.

English: Show us around.
French: Fais-nous faire le tour.

English: Eggs are sold by the dozen.
French: Les œufs sont vendus à la douzaine.

English: I can't find what I want.
French: Je ne trouve pas ce que je veux.

English: Don't think about stuff like that.
French: Ne pensez pas à de tels trucs !

English: My fate is in your hands.
French: Mon sort est entre tes mains.

English: Do your parents speak French?
French: Tes parents parlent-ils français ?

English: Gas was escaping from a crack in the pipe.
French: Le gaz s'échappait d'une fissure dans la conduite.

English: I'm working on it.
French: J'y travaille.

English: Let's not get discouraged.
French: Ne nous décourageons pas.

English: What do you call this bird?
French: Comment nomme-t-on cet oiseau ?

English: I wonder where she lives.
French: Je me demande où elle vit.

English: I am singing with my children.
French: Je chante avec mes enfants.

English: He did the right thing.
French: Il a fait ce qu'il fallait.

English: You've come too early.
French: Vous êtes venu trop tôt.

English: He tried getting closer to her using every possible means.
French: Il tenta de s'approcher d'elle en utilisant tous les moyens possibles.

English: You're my only real friend.
French: Tu es mon seul véritable ami.

English: It really bugged me.
French: Ça m'a vraiment ennuyé.

English: I only did it for your own good.
French: Je ne l'ai fait que pour ton bien à toi.

English: My roommate complained about the noise.
French: Mon camarade de chambrée s'est plaint du bruit.

English: I'd study harder if I were you.
French: J'étudierais plus assidument si j'étais vous.

English: I knew I had to tell him the truth, but I couldn't bring myself to do it.
French: Je savais que je devais lui dire la vérité, mais je n'arrivais pas à m'y résoudre.

English: I told you not to come here.
French: Je vous ai dit de ne pas venir ici.

English: This is all that is known so far.
French: C'est tout ce qu'on sait jusqu'à maintenant.

English: He was passive by nature.
French: Il était de nature passive.

English: If I had known it, I would have told you.
French: Si je l'avais su, je te l'aurais dit.

English: He tried writing a short story.
French: Il essaya d'écrire une nouvelle.

English: He didn't attend the meeting.
French: Il ne prit pas part à la rencontre.

English: Shut the door, please.
French: Fermez la porte, s'il vous plaît.

English: Are you really that stupid?
French: Êtes-vous vraiment si stupide ?

English: How come you didn't call me last night?
French: Pourquoi ne m'avez-vous pas appelé la nuit dernière ?

English: We like him.
French: Nous l'aimons bien.

English: I actually had fun tonight.
French: Je me suis en fait amusée, ce soir.

English: I can see it in your eyes.
French: Je le perçois dans tes yeux.

English: Tom said Mary was coming over for dinner.
French: Tom a dit que Marie venait pour le dîner.

English: I am yours and you are mine.
French: Je suis tienne et tu es mienne.

English: Did I do something stupid?
French: Ai-je fait quelque chose de stupide ?

English: I'll be back before you know it.
French: Je serai de retour en un tournemain.

English: Who turned off the light?
French: Qui a éteint la lumière ?

English: What he said made us angry.
French: Ce qu'il dit nous mit en colère.

English: I always take a bath before going to bed.
French: Je prends toujours un bain avant d'aller me coucher.

English: Why are you going to Japan? "To attend a conference in Tokyo."
French: Pourquoi vas-tu au Japon ?"Pour participer à une conférence à Tokyo.

English: It doesn't really matter much anymore.
French: Ça n'a plus vraiment beaucoup d'importance.

English: How would you like your steak done?
French: Quelle cuisson voudrais-tu pour ton bifteck ?

English: I wasn't fast enough.
French: Je n'étais pas assez rapide.

English: My life is such a mess.
French: Ma vie est un tel bordel !

English: She accused me of being a liar.
French: Elle m'accusa d'être une menteuse.

English: Mary carries pepper spray in her purse.
French: Mary a un spray au poivre dans son sac.

English: I enjoyed it very much.
French: J'y ai trouvé beaucoup de plaisir.

English: He tossed and turned all night.
French: Il s'est tourné et retourné toute la nuit.

English: I'll show you around the town.
French: Je te montrerai la bourgade.

English: Could you please reschedule the meeting at a time that is convenient for you?
French: Pourrais-tu, je te prie, re-programmer la réunion à une heure qui te convienne ?

English: You didn't tell me everything.
French: Vous, vous ne m'avez pas tout conté.

English: Stay out of it.
French: Ne t'en mêle pas !

English: I'm only going to say this once, so you better listen.
French: Je ne vais le dire qu'une seule fois, alors vous feriez mieux d'écouter.

English: I still enjoy that.
French: J'y prends encore plaisir.

English: I want you to go to Boston.
French: Je veux que tu ailles à Boston.

English: Do you weigh more than Tom?
French: Est-ce que tu pèses plus que Tom ?

English: We are not to be disturbed.
French: Il ne faut pas nous déranger.

English: I've heard of him, but I don't know him personally.
French: J'ai entendu parler de lui mais je ne le connais pas personnellement.

English: He began to feel ill.
French: Il a commencé à se sentir mal.

English: Don't worry. I told you everything would be OK.
French: Ne t'en fais pas. Je vous ai dit que tout irait bien.

English: I'm a long way from home.
French: Je suis loin de chez moi.

English: Just remember to have fun.
French: Souvenez-vous juste de prendre du bon temps.

English: Look at that picture.
French: Regarde cette image.
